Reviews.Title: “a good choice for accomodation in singapore”
Reviews.Author: yaefendi
Reviews.Content: location is good. it is in the china town and close to the touristic places. clean. internet is expensive. singapur'da gezmek isteyenler için normal şartları olan bir otel. turistik yerlere yakın ve temiz. fakat internet kullanımı paralı olup, gayet pahalı.

Reviews.Title: “poor value”
Reviews.Author: Hello037
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location. The pool is a bit run down and doesn't look much like the pictures. The real complate was a cold shower and the poor value for money. It was over £150 per night and I found hotels of only slighlty better quality for £60 per night.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: LY22
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel following our recent experience. We were very disappointed with the level of service we received and the quality of accommodation. The room was very musty and sheets on the bed damp. The view was of the lobby and not the expected cityscape. Staff were very unfriendly and not approachable. Internet access charges were very expensive and printing is charged for. Overall our stopover in Singapore was not as enjoyable as it could have been and for the rating and price this hotel is not good value for money. Having had a very positive experience of Furama in Bangkok we will now think twice before using them again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change from Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: jodster
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay away from the Orchard Rd area and apart from a few minor issues I was quite happy with the hotel. Check-in was a little long winded as even though my booking stated I was travelling with my 10 year old son and I had emailed the hotel to reconfirm this a week prior, yet again the Furama was another hotel that had given us a room with 1 queen bed. Seriously! After getting up to the room the lovely porter saw that I was quite distressed (we had just travelled for 12 hours), and kindly spoke to reception on my behalf and had us moved to a deluxe room within 15 minutes. I must say that I am glad he did as the deluxe room was much larger. (we were originally in a superior which was pokey). Strange that they simply could not have put us in the deluxe to start with. A couple of points to mention: Breakfast was ok, worth having it included but not the best I have had. Coffee was revolting! Location - as mentioned in previous posts it is in a great location, one block from the MRT and a stroll to Clark and Boat Quay which was a nice option for dinner and happy hour drinks on the water. The glass bathrooms - I know previous posts have mentioned this in a negative way but it really isn't a major problem as there is a full length blind running behind the bath that can be pulled down for privacy. Pool area/gym - nothing special but it was a nice way to cool off after a day of walking and we were often the only ones there. Pleased that the chlorine level wasn't sky high! The gym was small but the equipment was well maintained and the area very clean. Beds - I found them very hard. We asked for mattress toppers which made them a lot more comfortable and housekeeping arranged without any hassles. Staff - the porters and concierge were lovely and always smiling. It was very busy at times with flight crew (lots of Cathay Pacific and Air France) in the lobby but reception was well staffed and we had no issues. Overall - would I stay there again? Yes if I got the same rate (approx AUD160 per night) and only in the deluxe rooms. Shop around for a good rate. There are certainly better hotels around but you will be paying $$$ for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: redjim13
Reviews.Content: We can recommend this as an outstandingly staffed hotel in a very good location in Singapore. The staff are brilliant. On our third visit the staff became 'aware' that it was my wifes birthday during our stay. At ~3pm we received a phone call that hung up as soon as I picked up the handset. Five minutes later there was a knock at the door. Six of the staff were at the door with balloons and a spectacular chocolate cake singing 'happy birthday'. It was so sweet and so memorable, we cannot possibly stay anywhere else in Singapore. The executive lounge with all of its benefits in the evening and the delicious multicultural breakfasts are highly recommended. We can't imagine staying anywhere else in Singapore. Great rooms, great staff, great location. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: YennyW76
Reviews.Content: Location is the best. I love China Town area. Easy to go to shopping mall like OG and it is near Clarke Quay. Price is OK. Thanks to Ms Sachiko. She's so helpful and friendly. She made us really comfortable during our check-in. She is always smile every time she sees us in lobby. The problem with Furama is no free wifi :(

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel next door to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: LuceHenriette
Reviews.Content: I am just returning from Singapore where I stayed at the Furama City Centre for five nights. The hotel is very well situated (with Chinatown on one side and Clarke's Quay on the other). Every thing is close and when needed, easy to reach by metro or taxi (taxi fares are very low by north american standards which makes it really easy to visit sites that are a little bit out of the core). Rooms on higher floors provide for a great view of the city and you only need to ask upon arrival. Breakfast was included with my room and the buffet had something for every taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, acceptable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tankerman1
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else has commented upon, the location of the Furama City Centre hotel was perfect, and everything you can need is within walking distance. The hotel staff are friendly, helpful and always with a smile on their faces. The food is OK, but more geared up for the eastern pallette (I am from Scotland), but I loved the Bread and Butter pudding. Cleanliness was not a problem, but the rooms are a little bit dark. I like bright and airy rooms with lots of natural light, so if you also like this then try somewhere else. This not something wrong with the hotel, just a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BourneJ
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests the Furama is a hotel well located for some of the Singapore attractions. The closest of these is Clarke Quay which houses countless bars and restaurants. Boat Quay is only a stones throw away and has similar food and drink on offer. If you wish to go further afield to Orchard Road, Harbourfront or Sentosa, the MRT (Metro link) is very close by too. Du to the hotel being on the edge of Chinatown it looks like your typical yellow golden clad chinese style hotel on the outside but the rooms are not in the same style. The room i was given had a view towards the Singapore Flyer and was of a decent size. There was a glass wall between the bedroom and the bathroom and that makes this the 4th hotel I have stayed in with this delightful arrangement. It makes the room seem bigger and you can watch TV from the stand alone roll top bath, if you wish to. i didn't sample the food because with so many good restaurants nearby there was no point.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PenttiOlavi
Reviews.Content: Like the lokation, in the center so you can almoust walk to every interesting place. And chinatown nex to with good food and living city.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located!”
Reviews.Author: Lyrehs_Nosmas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last March 2-6, 2012 Furama City Center has great location. It is near Clarke Quay & Chinatown. Bust stop & MTR are just a stone throw away. I'm very picky about cleanliness! Kudos to the housekeeping staff of the hotel. After returning from a very long day of touring, my room was always kept clean. Toiletries were replenished. Towels were freshly-laundered. You'll appreciate the location of the hotel since its strategically located within the city center. I highly recommend this to people who has extra money to splurge & wants to get the most pun of it. Not recommended for budget travelers. My stay at the Deluxe room cost me Php 6,500 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Room @ 4th Floor”
Reviews.Author: MEC5020
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay in the (new?) renovated room. Compact room with glass wall, where you can look straight into the bathroom. They put a blind at one side of the wall, however there is still like 10 cm opening. Therefore, my niece, who came to visit us in our room, went to the toilet near the lobby. In addition, it is hard to put on make up due to the down light. We found out also that they came to check the bar/fridge stock. Unfortunately, they did not allow adequate times between pressing the bell and opening the door. So just remember to secure your door when you are resting in your room. We were not concern about the lack of view, since we are out most of days. I probably will stay again in this hotel due to the location, my husband prefer somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Captain-AA
Reviews.Content: Hard to remember number of visits to Furama. And I will return again. Good location, good rooms, excellent staff and lovely oriental food. I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TrueBrit_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning and end of a tour of Malaysia. On both occasions we were upgraded to an executive room, both of which had a very good view over the city, without being noisy as they were high up. The rooms were well furnished but in each case had only one armchair. The bathroom had a separate shower and a good range of toiletries of a generous size. The staff were very pleasant,helpful and efficient. We were able to leave a suitcase whilst we were travelling in Malaysia for 1$ a day at the hotel. Internet was free on our first visit, something to do with The Chinese New Year but on our return it was rather expensive....seemed more targeted at people travelling on expense accounts.We also used the swimming pool which was pleasant but it did need some designated shade area. The location of this hotel was excellent. There are a variety of eating places close by,several shopping plazas as well as the fascinating Chinatown. The Chinatown MTR station is two minutes away for travelling futher afield.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive & tired for what you get”
Reviews.Author: stephens066
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is central, the rooms have become rundown and tired. It's more like a 3 star, than the pricing of a 4-5 star. The foyer is nice/current. Rooms are tidy, though there is nothing special about them. The airconditioner was noisy and ineffective. Towles old and stained.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but old hotel”
Reviews.Author: KhalidQ8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in an executive room , so my experience will be different than other travellers. The room was a bit small but recently renovated and very clean. The hotel is in a very good location and close by to everything. It cost $10 SGD by taxi to get to Sentosa island . The staff are very friendly, speak fluent english and are very helpful. The breakfast buffet is really good in terms of food variety and quality. however, the main stream dining hall gets very busy and also getting food would be somewhat challenging. In my case , I was having my breakfast in the executive lounge which has its own buffet and tables which was excellent. All in all my experience was positive mainly due to staying in an executive room, although it was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pickypick
Reviews.Content: Old 4 star hotel. Has a feeling of a 5 star 90s hotel. Walking 3 minutes to the Chinatown metro. The surrounding area doesn't have anything special but being next to the metro is enough. Clean room, nice beds, clean bathroom, breakfast was so so although there is a big variety of things you can eat. Overall I could say for the price that we paid (70$) and comparing to other Singapore hotel prices it def worths the money.

Reviews.Title: “I am a smoker couldnt handle this place”
Reviews.Author: vince s
Reviews.Content: I know when you ask for a room where you can smoke in , but what we got was the same as having a smoke at the dug out at the airport , but apart from that we did explore as much of the downtown area ,Quay port or whatever it was called ,Marina bay sands hotel impressive ,the singapore flyer ,a great restuarant called the Fishermans Wharfe near Quay port absolute bargain if you love fresh seafood and dont fall for the traditional crab routine because this place serves the lot and as many times as you like for around $49 aus //chilli crab ,pepper crabs, prawns ,oysters the lot you wont be disapointed // fell for the fish therapthy in Marina Sands ,still waiting for spiritual change in my body ,i am thinking mr Right on Foxtel is full of it cos thats where i saw it first ,with my crusty chassis i hope the little grubs choked .Beautiful city to visit but toooooo expensive.See yah Vince

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value (for Singapore)”
Reviews.Author: Matjesill
Reviews.Content: A typical 3-star hotel and in e.g. Bangkok this would not be considered good value for money. But if you don't want to spend a fortune on sleeping this is the best option I've found in Singapore so far. The lobby is dark but there is plenty of people working behind the counter so you don't have to spend so much time there. We had booked a club room and the "lounge" is on the first floor - so no views while you sip on your free drinks (the only window is actually facing the lobby). Staff is friendly and professional. The room was clean and functional but with a dark interior that gave an outdated feeling. The big window with a decent view helped though. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but there was plenty of different options - some of them edible - so I didn't leave hungry. Free WiFi also in the room. The really nice thing about this hotel is the location. The business quarters are just across the street as well as China town. Clarke Quay is a 3 minute walk away which a great place to hang out for food and drinks after a day of business meetings. If you want to go further away there is a MRT station within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Furama City Centre”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVacn
Reviews.Content: Stopped in here for three nigths for a business trip. I visited a few days before Chinese New Year so it was very central and near China Town. Ok to walk from Hotel to the eating areas on the other side of the river. Hotel was good medium level - when i was there there was bunch of school kids that did a lot of running up and down aisles and ringing room telephones but other than that - fine mid range Hotel. Internet was $25 for 24 hours, no free wi fi. Had a room on teh 7th floor - outlook was the air conditioning units - pretty ordinary. Local shopping centre right over the road that was full of Tailors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent facilities”
Reviews.Author: richieathome
Reviews.Content: The standard of the hotel was good, everything you would expect; TV, internet, mini bar and safe (although I could not get it to work). Bathroom was clean with a good powerful shower. The location was great just five minutes walk from the main market streets in Chinatown and the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Christmas 2011 for 10 days, paid for de luxe room but was only allocated basic (I think they were downgrading package clients because they could sell to others at a higher rate) they insisted the room was correct although even their own webpage indicated otherwise. Room was clean but very basic and carpets worn down to the nap. We did not eat there since the hotel was only a 10 minute walk from Clarke Quay with a multitude of excellent restaurants. This was our 6th hotel in Asia in 18 months (some just 3 star) but was undoubtedly the worst)

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to the Executive Club its worth it”
Reviews.Author: Shellynel
Reviews.Content: On arrival we asked for the cost of upgrading and we thought it was quite reasonable considering what is included in the Executive Club. The staff there are warm, friendly and genuine and were interested in what we were doing and were fantastic in assisting us in our varying needs. If you smile and be friendly you more than likely get that in return. We will stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but very tired hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tr0lly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama City Centre in November 2011. Our room was small and in need of modernisation but very clean and adequate as a base to from which to explore Singapore. The room and corridor on the 13th floor smelled musty and damp. We asked for something to be done about it and a machine was immediately installed in our room and the corridor which helped a little, but I think that it is generally a problem in the hotel. The pool was a real disappointment, very shabby indeed. I expected to have a quick swim after a day sightseeing, but having looked at it I didn't bother! The hotel also charges to use WiFi which I believe is ridiculous in Singapore. On the positive side, the location was excellent for sightseeing, we walked to Clarke Quay in 10 minutes and Chinatown is on the doorstep. There are also a number of MRT stations nearby. The staff were all very kind and efficient. Breakfast was plentiful with a wide variety of Western and Oriental foods. Someone else summed up the hotel very well, saying "would you prefer a posh hotel with far too many people trying to have breakfast at once and where none of the staff know who you are or the Furama, which is a bit dated and tired but the staff welcome you and always recognise you at breakfast?" I think somewhere in between.....

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: TX_Flyer001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and has a great location. The rooms are a bit older and the hotel does not offer free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: RKenia
Reviews.Content: This place is very well located. It's minutes from the MRT, there's plenty of food, its very close to Raffles and therefore Boat Quay but that is the only great thing about it. The rooms are reasonably big and clean but the exterior is a little dingy. The lobby is small, the restaurant Tiffany where they serve breakfast is also small and I found myself sharing a table with complete strangers. Aside of that, it was very noisy and chaotic. Very little room to serve yourself and walk around. We're vegetarians and the hotel breakfast offers very little vegetarian food aside from toast and salad. So for all vegetarians, it's not worth to pay for breakfast especially since veg food is available quite easily in Singapore. All in all, I did not think this place is value for money. We ended up paying slightly more and getting a better hotel at Scott's Road for the second leg of our trip. Not only was the hotel better, the rooms were bigger and the location far nicer. Unless you get a very competitive rate, I'd advise paying a little more and staying at nicer places.

Reviews.Title: “More than expectation”
Reviews.Author: EwokKL
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent traveller for both business and leisure, I must say this is one of the best option in Singapore for the rate we paid. The room is big and the bed is very comfortable. We booked directly from the hotel website for the promotional rate which it also included breakfast for 2. The rate was only S$189. I do not think you could get any closer for a 4 stars hotel. I was also tempted to book Park Royal Beach Road ealier but chose Furama City Centre for the location. It is very close to the MRT station. The buffet breakfast is also sufficient. We stay here for 2 nights but was in Porcelain Hotel nearby the earlirt night. The rate was almost the same but without breakfast. Even we were upgraded to an Executive Room but the room is really too small..... Please read our review on the hotel separately. We will definitely return to Furama City Centre again without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for a fair stay”
Reviews.Author: Gracie2307
Reviews.Content: The Furama city hotel should not be confused with the Furama river front. The hotel is nice. I was upgraded which was nice. My room was very modern and as I understand, it was vastly different to the basic room. I had some complications at my checkout. I was requested to pay more than what I was quoted on my confirmation letter. This was quickly sorted out. I would recommend to stay here, but I think for the pricing, you can do a little better. The hotel location is right in China town. You can't get any better located than this if you want to see China town. Close to the train station (MRT) and easy to et taxis.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: adaptation30
Reviews.Content: i'm 30 years old was travelling with a mate. travelled extensively. chain hotel. fairly old. others have commented that the deluxe rooms or the suite rooms are nice. i stayed the standard room at 175 US per night. far far too expensive for what we got. room smelt slightly mouldy. small. starting to get old. normal hotel service, and good beds. breakfast terribly expensive, 9 US for a glass orange juice. good to use as a base but not to chill out in. location is excellent. near most touristy stuff. the quay etc. close to china town and also the subway. i previously stayed on east coast parkway near marine parade. for 100US i got a much much larger room, seperate lounge, and big walkin bathroom. you pay for location here. charging $5 US for 15 mins to use thier slow internet was incredibly frustrating. bought a mobile wireless internet the next day for 50 US and couldn't be happier. stay here if its your first time or you want a bed to sleep in, but if you are confident to try to use the subway stay further away and get a much nicer and bigger and cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dim_Sum_Fun
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at the Furama in May 2011. The location in Chinatown was brilliant, easy for the MRT, Food choices superb. Though the hotel is a little old, we found it to be very comfortable, clean, the staff were friendly and willing to help with any queries, a nice place to come "home" to after days and nights out checking out this excellent country. We are going back again in March and staying here again..........

Reviews.Title: “Slightly better than the average.”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for four days, and as it was booked through my company I can't comment on the price. First impressions are generally good, and you can expect a similar level and quality of service through out your stay. I stayed in a twin room on the 7th floor with a reasonable view. The room was clean and presented nicely with fresh fruit on the side, and certainly had plenty of space for one or two people sharing. The Tiffany Restaurant buffet was of average standard, but was simply too crowded at breakfast and dinner - plates would run out, then they would struggle to keep up with demand for the popular dishes. Overall I wouldn't be upset if I was booked in here again by my company, but there are better places to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Whenever we visit Singapore, we stay here ...”
Reviews.Author: Bez T
Reviews.Content: On all three of our visits to Singapore, we have stayed at this hotel and been more than happy with the standards and service - so much so, we will be booking to stay there again next year on our next visit. We love the location, which is in the midst of China Town, with great malls and so many excellent places to dine out right on the door step. The local food halls are great for grabbing a cheap, tasty snack - beats McD's any day!! There is a fascinating array of foods and good on offer in the Malls and pretty much anything you might need or want is easily available. The hotel itself offers efficent and friendly service and the rooms have always been clean and well maintained. Love the roof-top outdoor swimming pool, which is high above the hustle and bistle of the traffic below. As most of the rooms are well above ground level, most have great views out across the city - especially impressive at night. Make sure to make visits to Raffles and Little India while you're in Singapore, both of which offers tastes of quintessential Singapore and if you can, dine at Flutes of The Fort Restaurant, which is in what used to be the old Firw chief's House - and in my opinion offers one of the best dining experiences in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Where not to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: hgVN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because it seemed well located. Expensive (300 USD per night) still but not as expensive as many other hotels in this very pricey city. The place is run down and our twin-share room hardly big enough to swing a cat in. Breakfast not included and 25 USD extra if you could eat that much worth! Running late one morning and had a quick coffee downstairs at 8 USD a cup. Pretty soulless. Staff nice enough. Stingy with the "extras" in the room. Only two sachets of coffee each day (for two people) and when I grabbed a handful of extras from a housekeeping cart one morning, found when we returned that the extras had been removed. Only one bathrobe for two people. And if we wanted to use the wifi had to pay a lot for it.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for China Town area”
Reviews.Author: Vegetarian4ever
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room with medium sized room and pleasant shower. Good view from my window across the main street but this depends how high up you are. Lobby spacious. above Satisfactory service but reception desk can be very busy peak time. Near a shopping centre with three floors and food courts -not so far to walk. Can also walk to Clerk Quay marina from here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing food and good service”
Reviews.Author: gogreen505
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Singapore for business and was told I'd have to stay in China town. I was not very excited about the stay in China Town but had no option as the other preferred hotel located on Orchard road was all booked. The outside appearance of the hotel is not very great but once we entered the hotel we didnt feel like leaving it even after a 15-day stay. Amazing rooms, excellent view (from the 18th floor). Scrumptious breakfast buffet and evening snack and drink menu. The white wine was amazing and so were the evening delicacies, especially the mango pastry (I have a sweet tooth). Location wise also i guess its the best, although I would like to stay on orchar road better but Furama is centrally located and everything from the MTR to McD is a stones throw away. You can just take a stroll into china town and enjoy the chinese culture.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient Chinatown location”
Reviews.Author: benz37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about four years, and judging from the room I had this time, the hotel has done some nice upgrading since then. The standard room is still small, and somewhat oddly shaped, but nicely furnished with good lighting, a big comfortable bed, and both a shower and a tub.There's a small, but adequate, gym in the building, as well as a pool and hot tub. They also have a coin operated washer and dryer, which was exactly what I happened to need during my stay! Internet is available, but rather pricy ($25 Sing per day). Parking is free if you have a car, or have guests driving to visit you. The location is quite good, just a block from the Chinatown MRT station, and about a 10-15 minute walk to the riverfront area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Quady83
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at this hotel whilst working in Singapore for a few months and I stayed for a week whilst visiting him. The hotel is in a great location next to Chinatown and Clarke Quay. The rooms were a good size, clean and we had a great view of the city. The rooftop pool was also nice and usually very quiet. This hotel is a great choice for a weekend break in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Tardykat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and our room wasn't ready for checking until 2:30pm. Hotel reception was very courteous and apologetic. Our room was 916, towards the end of the hall. Two free bottles of water a day. Room had 2 twin beds, considered a superior room category. Room amenities--electric tea kettle, coffee/tea items, hair dryer, AC, room safe, robes and disposable room slippers. Bathroom toiletries contained lotion, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and toothbrush, don't see that anymore! Tub drain was a bit slow. Plenty of counter space and a very deep sink. Room was brightly lit, overlooks the hotel pool. Buffet breakfast was fantastic! There were many stations with a huge variety--Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Indian, continental, salad bar, cold cuts, cereal, bread, muffin. There was even an omelet station. There were 7 types of beverages alone. Coffee machine didn't make very good coffee though. Most of the items remain the same every morning with a few items changed. Location was very close to Chinatown and the Chinatown MRT. The hotel is connected to adjacent buildings. The main entrance, pedestrian-wise from the ground floor shares space with the vehicle entrance. Upon first glance, is a bit shady. Directly across the hotel entrance is a large multi-story car park and a mall; with each successive mall thereafter, all connected.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, Friendly staff, Good location”
Reviews.Author: megan e
Reviews.Content: We had a stopover in Singapore on our way back to Australia from Paris and we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. On arrival the staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room was very modern, clean and huge compared to a lot we had stayed in in Europe for similar prices. The best thing about the hotel is it's location. Although it is on a busy road the hotel is very quiet and you can walk out the door across the road and step onto the MRT railway line to travel around Singapore. You are also withing a 10 minute walk of Chinatown and Clarke Quay where you can find many wonderful places to eat from cheap and cheerful food courts, street dining in the evenings and lovely upper class restaurants along the Singapore River, as well as plenty of bars if you like the night life or need to watch you favorite sporting event on the big screen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DwTokidoki
Reviews.Content: It's my first time to check into Furama City Center. My colleague told me to try it out simply because it was near the office. Here are my reviews: 1. Its located right smack in the middle of the city - near downtown. Airport -> Hotel Taxi fare estimates at S$ 18-20 Hotel -> Orchard fare estimates at S$ 10 2. Hotel lobby has no weird funky spicy smell. 3. I find checking in a bit slow because the staff took 20 mins to finish everything. 4. The room is nice, spacious and no funky smell. 5. Bathroom has a separate tub and shower. Also spacious. 6. Breakfast is good and reasonable. 7. Staffs are friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Average Staff”
Reviews.Author: Swapnil G
Reviews.Content: Visited last year & stayed for about 5 days. Great loaction. 5 mins walk from People centre ( hub for local shops & food ) and good connectivity to the rest city. Staff was polite but was not very helpful.Initially we were offered a very small room & when we showed our concern they changed to a better room in the same category ( delux room ) , We did not understood the reason of giving us such an impression on the first go , possible they were priortising the Europeans over Asians, as a group of flight crew was staying during our stay. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good centrally located city center hotel (be it with some issues!)”
Reviews.Author: Worldwide_Waterbuffs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Furama at the beginning of October in a superior room. The staff were helpful and very friendly offering us a welcome drink which was well received after a 13hr flight. The room itself was spacious, with large bed and nice bathroom with power shower, bath etc. I must note I did find the shower a little temperamental temperature-wise, going from very hot to very cold! The location of the hotel is ideal for a few days site seeing, being 5mins walk from Boat & Clarke Quay. The only drawbacks are that although the hotel has an outside pool, it does not have full spa facilities (sauna, steam room) and I was a little dubious of the state of some of the corridors leading to the standard rooms as they looked in need of an overhaul. One other thing to note, was that we were on the 4th floor and the sound-proofing of the traffic outside was very poor meaning a few nights of disturbed sleep. Breakfast was excellent, with a choice of fruit, bacon/sausages/beans etc, waffles and local cuisine. Overall, although it has some teething problems, it is still recommended as a good base for sight-seeing

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: rogersgrac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club room for 5 nights. Quality of room was ok. Reasonable sized bathroom. Bedroom had 2 small chairs and a tiny table, queen size bed and long built in set of drawers with tv on top. Tv remote was difficult to use perhaps needed new batteries. Tv quality was ok however a couple of channels were blurry. Club lounge was a bit depressing as was located next to the hotel lobby with large windows so all guests could view pretty much everyone in the club. Standard of food in the club was good. Particularly breakfast with hot options and you could order from the restaurant which was great as we had been there for 5 nights. Cocktail hour also had lovely samosas etc. Swimming pool was too visible to guests as I found a guy watching me from his room. t Thankfully when I waved at hime he became embrassed and stopped watching.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: For the price at Furama I think it is unbeatable. Most places in Singapore are outrageous. As an exchange student with some buddies just looking for a decent play to lay our heads we found this one online and went with it as it was a good price and a good location. Like I said it was a cheap price so I had low expectations coming in, but really was amazed when I saw that Furama really is a first-rate hotel. The room was really clean and nice. I really thought it was top-notch. The amentiies there are great. We never ate at the restaurant there in the hotel, but it looked and smelled good. Its really close to Clarke Quay which is another great amenity to this hotel. Its right next to a subway station which is convenient for traveling the city. There are great restaurants and other things nearby within walking distance. Overall, the room, location, and price for a hotel make Furama fantastic. The only negative thing I have to say about the place is that it is very hot in Singapore and they do not allow you to control your air conditioning. We turned it down as cold as possible but it still just blows the same temperature. Our room was somewhat warm at times, which I hate when I am trying to go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A good value stay”
Reviews.Author: f1photos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the F1 weekend and the hotel coped well with my need to stay on European time. The room was functional with enough power sockets for all my tech. Let down by the terrible Internet connection which limited you to 500mb. Interestingly this increased to 1000mb the day after the F1 finished. The location was great for the race being only a few minutes walk from the track, also close to Clarke Quay for food and drink all night.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely value-4-money, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: Location, not really ideal but with a free shuttle bus to town, it's perfect. Rather grand hotel, usual check-in without hiccup. We booked an executive club room and the room is spacious n unique. The bathroom is separated with glass hence u can watch tv while soaking in the bathtub. I like the idea of a stone platform in the shower to stand on when u bathe. The bed is huge and comfy. Quiet as well. The window screen allows u to control the amount of sunlight u want in ur room. Furniture and carpet do seem tired n old, but we overlooked those as the room is splendid. Breakfast is great, with great variety n good quality food. We chose to have our breakfast at The Square instead of the executive club lounge. Evening cocktail at the lounge was great too. Service is wonderful. Definitely value for money n I will be going back again

Reviews.Title: “Not really "City Centre"”
Reviews.Author: Sparkette1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a 3 day stopover on the way to Penang. Told our travel agent that we wanted something central as we were planning on trying to see everything we could of Singapore during our short stay. Wouldn't really recommend if you are going for sight-seeing as it is located in the business district amongst banks etc, so there isn't alot to see or do without getting a taxi to the Orchard Road area. Lack of restaurants in close vicinity too. We arrived in the morning (approx 8am) and were told that our room wasn't ready as it had been let out the previous night - even though we requested an early check in. Had to wait in the lobby for about 3 - 4 hours for the room to be cleaned. As we had flown through the night and hadn't had any sleep, we were not impressed. Other than that, the room was clean and comfortable. The restaurant got extremely full during breakfast, they had to sit some guests in the function room. Food was of good quality. If you just want somewhere to sleep and don't mind having to get a taxi everywhere, then I guess it is an ok hotel. I wouldn't recommend if you want to be able to sight-see on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Old Favourite”
Reviews.Author: Benny053
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to everywhere. MRT a stones throw away with Chinatown at your doorstep; food, shopping, etc.. Good buffet at breakfast with plenty of variety although halal. Entertainment at night. Rooms are clean and have been renovated. Some people may be put off by glass see through (walls) for bathroom. Good bed, linen, towels, shower and amenities. It is good to be remembered by concierge staff having stayed there previously; it's almost like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdeNgan
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is comfortable and clean. Just 10min walk to the MRT station and it near the night clubbing area. I like the food in China Town. The main problem of this hotel is no free wi-fi services. Anyhow, most of the hotels in Singapore also don't have such service:(

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: hwy401
Reviews.Content: A grand, elegant hotel with spacious hallways and smallish, well-appointed, clean rooms. Right at the Chinatown MRT station. Lots of shops and eateries in the immediate area, including a Chinese department store worth a look and 3-For-$10 dollar stores where I bought a bunch of keychains for giveaway souvenirs. I could have got three men's (or ladies') watches for $10! The hotel charges about $25 for in-room internet. Bring your ethernet extension cord -- the in-room internet is cable only. You can also get wireless internet for use in public areas, for a separate charge. Oh yes, they'll also cut you off if your downloads exceed 500 GB. The good news is the hotel features free in-room cable TV!!! Just kidding. I looked for a local free internet spot but couldn't find one. McDonalds has free internet in Singapore but you have to register for it, and you need a local Singapore mobile number for them to download your connection details to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nitin08
Reviews.Content: I was on a holiday with my wife selected this hotel after going through various reviews.I would rate it as 5/5 on location.Just a thrown away from China Town MRT.All major attractions walkable, lot of eatries around.Our stay was comfortable, though we reach a lil early then our expected arrival the room was done properly and checkin was quick.We enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: tusharmago
Reviews.Content: checkin process was smooth, were shown the way to the lift, room was pretty clean and had a great view, hotel has a great location right next to clarke quay and MRT. overall our experience was good and we will be back again :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel reeks of mold”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: The Furama City Centre was one of the hotels I stayed at during a prior visit to Singapore some years back. While hardly glamorous, it offered functional accommodation very near chinatown and clark quay and just steps from a metro entrance. I thought I would save some money by staying there again this trip. Big mistake. My main complaint from my last trip had been the mold smell. It was even worse this time. The first room I was given on this trip was on a newly-renovated floor. Everything in the room was new. But the smell of mold was so overpowering in the room, and even throughout the hallway on that floor, that I couldn't stand it. I was happy to move to a more dated-appearing unrenovated room on another floor. That room smelled of mold, too, but the smell wasn't half as bad as in the first room. Pros - location; near metro, near chinatown & clark quay - price is lower than at many other hotels of this size in the city - swimming pool, small fitness room - coin-operated washer & dryer available Cons - awful smell, as described above - reception staff pleasant but not particularly efficient - internet access was very expensive and very slow; it actually ended up being less expensive for me to just go out and buy a dongle and pay for wireless internet service from one of the local wireless companies - I made the mistake of staying in the room while one of the housekeepers cleaned; at one point she reached into the garbage with her bare hand to grab and take away some soiled tissues I'd thrown out (I really wish I hadn't seen that) - the cost of using the washer & dryer was very high, plus someone apparently kept opening the door of the dryer (when I had gone back to my room) but then failing to restart it; I had to keep putting in more money to get a single load of clothes fully dried (this obviously isn't the hotel's fault, but it's something you should be aware of if you plan to use the equipment) There are much, much better hotels around town. Unless you're on a tight budget, treat yourself to a nicer place. I certainly wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Strump
Reviews.Content: Room was big for Singapore but Executive club was poor compared to Traders, only access is 5pm - 7pm Club staff very friendly, priority check in but no check out Service desk not very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: jon o
Reviews.Content: I was here on business so was expecting a lot. The rooms are immaculate and decent. Big beds, great view of marina bay (not the MBS). Great water pressure in the shower. In March the pool was cold, and that area is a bit unloved, with mouldy awnings and a bit aged looking. Breakfast was good (halal kitchen so no bacon) and the attendant always remembered my room number!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: pippa24055
Reviews.Content: this was an excellent hotel. we arrived at the hotel at 9am and were able to check in early and were given our room by 11. this was brilliant as we had just got off a 13 hour flight from UK. we had an executive room which meant we got use of the executive lounge which was lovely. not all that sure the other guests appreciated our 2 year old but the staff could not have been more helpful pool was clean and there was never anybody else in there having never been to singapore before cant say much about the location but it was close to tube stations and this made getting around really easy

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel921
Reviews.Content: Travelled with with brother and sisters for my birthday reunion. Stayed for 3 nights, took two rooms. Requested for a non smoking room but was given a smoking room instead. Location is great, chinatown at your doorstep, food at the hawkers centre was great and truly a wonderful experience. Staff were very friendly and helpful, some of the front desk people need to smile a bit though. On our second day, we wanted to go to Universal Studios, have approached the girl at the counter near the escalator (she has tourist brochures around her) if we can book one. told us that Universal Studios is fully booked due to school holidays. We instead took the chance and went to Universal (all six of us). We got tickets easily and no hassle and whatever she told us was a lie!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, staff friendly ,very close to clark quay”
Reviews.Author: caroline255103
Reviews.Content: At first when we arrived i thought yuc !! as i am very fussy about where i stay , but dont be put off by the surroundings outside, All the staff except one person was very nice and very helpfull, we had a deluxe room on the fourth floor this floor is like a rabbit waren,,,but you get use to it, our room was very nice very modern the only criticism was there was no wardrobe space there was a hanging rail to the right above the sink and two drawers no drawers at the side of the bed either and there was a great big empty space behind the bed , and the bed was hard ,so we had to keep most of our clothes in our suitecase we were there for 7 days,The food for breakfast was very good heaps to choose from ,It is in a great location for mrt ,buses, and eating we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff..”
Reviews.Author: Australian-Nomad
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many other hotels in Singapore over the years I have to say that the Furama City Centre in Singapore although well located has appalling staff. From the duty manager downtown the front desk, the staff that I met were simply rude and showed no respect or decent manners at any time. Ironically, the room I had was fine and the location of the hotel is great. If you like people treating you in a rude and patronizing manner then this is the place for you. However if you prefer to stay in a hotel with friendly respectful staff who value their guests then STAY AWAY!! Maybe try the NAUMI or Le Rendezvous these are much better choices. Would I stay at the Furama again? NO WAY! Would I recommend it to anyone? NO WAY! Oh and by the way I thought Singapore was THE most advanced city in Asia yet the Furama has NO WIFI INTERNET in the rooms (only the lobby) and they charge you $25 for Internet access!! It's a rip off with rude staff...STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, big rooms, large bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Rakesh37
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in more than 5-6 hotels in Singapore, this package came to me as a delight. No cramped rooms, no need to find place to put your luggage and best thing much bigger bathrooms with bathtub as a cherry on the topping. Rooms are pretty bigger at 32 sqm (superior). It has a large size window but since I was on 7th floor, could not enjoy the city view. Advise that one should look for higher floors. Room carpets are worn out and management should seriously think of replacing them as they seem to be eye sore in mid of luxurious environment. Bathrooms have got a bath tub and complete with all amenities. Amenities in room includes, iron with ironing board, tea/ coffee maker, mini bar but to my surprise with a CTV (no LCD) Check in, check out was smooth. Could not enjoy the restaurant & bar as I was there only for a day but yes, they do serve buffet but it is expensive. Internet is per machine and is very very expensive. God knows why internet in hotels are so expensive in Singapore when infact it is very cheap if one wants to get it in home Good value for money spent (if breakfast was included in the rate, I would have marked it as 5)

Reviews.Title: “It definitely is value for money”
Reviews.Author: kasturee
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious. The hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. A must go

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the loaction, not for the food”
Reviews.Author: shalinder123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least twice. The hotel is centrally located and recently renovated. The rooms are confortable and well appointed but a lot of rooms don't have any windows. The most outstanding thing about this hotel is the food. The last time I stayed here the food although looking very appealing and lavish but taste wise was litterally aweful. After going through the mainly singaporean-chinese main courses and not finding anything good to taste I zeroed in on the ice-cream section thinking that atleast should taste the standard; but lo behold even the ice-cream tasted bland. I was shocked to find such an aweful buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Would most likely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: janey85
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here over the easter break, arriving quite early in the morning. The check in time was 2pm, but the staff told us to come back around 12ish and theyd endeavour to have our room ready early and look after our bags in the meantime. We got back to the hotel before 12pm and the room was ready, we really appreciated being able to get in our room those couple of hrs early and have a quick snooze before heading out for the afternoon/evening. We chose the hotel due to the price and the location. Right next to the Chinatown MRT, Chinatown and a reasonable walk to Clarke Quay was really handy. And for the price, we got a very clean room, the two single beds that we'd requested and a reasonable view. Alothough clean, the rooms were getting a bit dated and tired. The staff were very friendly and helpful and a power adaptor was available at reception on request. The only real drawback for me was the gym, a couple of peices of equipment tucked away in a dingy little room. I would stay at the Furama again for a short stay and would recommend it to people travelling on a budget, pretty good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but there are nicer options out there”
Reviews.Author: ruwaniebell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location as it is close to both Clarke Quay and Chinatown MRT stations (around 125m walk from CQ and 225m from Chinatown); there is also a bus stop nearby. Rooms were comfortable and more spacious than we expected, but rather impersonal - not the kind of room you would want to spend an evening lounging around in, but perfectly fine for sleeping in. The view from the room was pretty disastrous as it looked out over a roof and the backs of some commercial buildings. The facade of the hotel needs work as it looks quite old and frankly dirty from the outside; however inside it was extremely clean. The service was just about average - friendly, helpful staff but nothing outstanding or particularly memorable. The buffet breakfast was also average - certainly not among the best I have experienced. Overall, the hotel is quite comfortable and the location is convenient; however if you are looking for a personal touch and a place that you can relax and unwind in after a long day, this is not it. The hotel is probably best suited for business travelers rahter than holiday-goers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Overlook This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fateater
Reviews.Content: Originally I had planned on staying at the Swissotel Stamford again due to its excellent location. At the planned time of stay, the rate was around $200usd per night. Now I'm not exactly crazy about the Swissotel, but it is clean and does the job. At $200usd though, I wanted to look for alternatives. Ultimately we settled for the Furama City Centre. Upon arriving, the hotel itself looks rather old from the outside. When we got to our deluxe room, it was small but very clean and quite comfortable. You can tell that the room has been remodeled. But at least we got our requested room with smoking and a single queen bed with zero hassle. They even allowed us to check-in 30 minutes before the actual check-in time of 2pm. Last time we couldn't even check-in at the Swissotel until almost close to 4pm, even though we arrived at 1:30pm (another reason why we looked for alternatives). One of the main draws to the location of this hotel is that it's right next to Chinatown. Not only Chinatown, but also the Chinatown MRT (5 min.) and Clark Quay MRT (8 min.). So the Swissotel is right on top of the City Hall MRT, but the walking time is actually about the same or more, depending on how busy it is on the way. The one thing that wasn't so great is the hotel gym. It consisted of a treadmill, some hand barbells, and a situp machine. How small is the gym? About double the size of the hotel bathroom, that's how small it is. But definitely not a deal-breaker on a short 4 night stay. Never once was the hotel lobby noisy and packed with people. Checkout took us a whopping 30 seconds. So that's another advantage of not staying in a large mega-hotel. Checking in and out is fast and stress-free. So if you're looking for a clean hotel located in an area with some more character and lots of food bargains in the surrounding area, Furama is an excellent choice. It's already on our list as a top choice next time we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: RocketGirlBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights before going to Thailand. Builiding is not the prettiest but rooms are spaceous and modern. The hotel is located close to China Town (walking distance) which was quite handy. There is also a small gym - small room with a few exercise machines. Not very inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big business hotel with a tiny gym”
Reviews.Author: satu r
Reviews.Content: Rooms are convenient and supply of pillows is great. Very quiet. Could not adjust the room temperature - kept 27C way too hot. Gym is very basic and tiny, pool on the rooftop was nice. Wireless internet costs $5 for 15 min :( but broadband cable in the room is free. Service is polite but serious and formal. Bfast is good and good location too.

Reviews.Title: “Furama, a lovely place for simple pleasures”
Reviews.Author: LoritaA87
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two-weeks for a conference. All expenses paid by my employer, so in terms of value and expenses, it is a little unfair for me to make any solid opions. However the service and products I will give in. 1. Lounge/Lobby;- a little dark, the lighting and green scenery hanging from the sides dont really compliment each other, but rather darkens the first impression of the hotel. I just prefer a lighter atmosphere to lift spirits when I am travelling. 2. Elevator;- 4 in total one elevator was out of service for over 2 weeks. maintenance rate could improve. 3. Rooms;- I had the executive deluxe (I think), a non-smoking and no-mini bar room. Provided ample space, an OK view of the city and swimming pool. Cleaners were always great with service, towels and linen were satisfactory. TV however provided little comfort when you are not in the mood of going out. Some of the cable-programs offered were repetitive. 4. Complimentary Breakfast;- they provide considerably to multi-cultural appetites and restrictions, but they also provide for the general appetite that can consume real pork bacon instead of beef bacon and chicken bacon (? wth) Croissants were a little stale. Other than those little details;- the breakfast was great. 5. Staff;- Friendly and helpful. Although there were some that looked like they had a sh*tty day and then taking it out on other clients -kind-of-vibe. Overall, staff was exceptionally hospitable. 6. Location;- lovely and accessible to all the hot spots, McDonalds, MRT, Clarke Quay etc. 7. LAST BUT NOT THE LEAST, INTERNET CHARGES;- too expensive, they charge 0.35cents/minute for broadband connection in rooms, that comes to $21/hour (SGD) and if you go over ONE hour or 500MB then they will charge $25.00/day. So might as well go for the daily rate and watch out for your downloads. They have an internet room of $5.00/15mins or $8.00/30mins. A little ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Very good SIA Stopover hotel, central position”
Reviews.Author: countrygirluk
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were offered an upgrade to an excellent room, with plenty of space. Hotel is in an excellent location for sightseeing, being near the Riverfront cafes, restaurants and sights such as Asian Civilisation Musem, and near Chinatown. We ate in the hotel restaurant a la carte one evening - an excellent steak. We found the service both in the restaurant and the bar to be very good. On our way back through we stopped at a different hotel, and we much preferred this one.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: experiencedir
Reviews.Content: Booked on wotif.com and was overall happy with the room, the only surprise i had was that the room had no natural light as it was a room overlooking the internal lobby atrium. Gym is very basic and sits in what looks like a housekeepers pantry. Design of the floors very confusing and you can frind yourself walking around and around trying to find your room. Overall a clean and quiet room with comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “WIFI acces 1 hour for 15SIN$ (12 us$)”
Reviews.Author: raz64321
Reviews.Content: Internet cafe in Singapour cost 2$ an hour ! Overprices and painful. Broadband in the room, wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I don't like the lobby aerea!!”
Reviews.Author: Gemini1972_06_05
Reviews.Content: The hotel has got a good position if you wish to visit Singapore city. Rooms have not balcony. Not all the rooms are no-smoking. The entrance is dark. The staff is really professional.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location for a short Singapore stay!”
Reviews.Author: NaiNai38
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of Singapore A.L. package and was unsure of hotel. I was very pleased with room and staff. GREAT location for a short stay. Restaurant is not the best deal even with a discount that goes with the package. This is an expensive city and it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TGirlZA
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as part of a Singapore Stopover deal, mainly because it is situated in Chinatown, which we were very keen to explore. On arrival, the exterior didn't look promising - though the location was indeed perfect - but what a suprise upon entering. We received 5* treatment from the moment we arrived, and were chuffed to be upgraded to a larger room to boot. Service was extremely friendly and helpful throughout, and the room was delightful and had everything we needed. The only reason I'm not actually rating this as a 5 is that the deal didn't include breakfast and we didn't eat/drink at the hotel (only because we were determined to eat only local/hawkers market food while in Singapore) - so don't know what that aspect/the spa etc. were like. The food did obviously appear far more expensive than what you could locate outside the hotel, but that's to be expected. I don't know whether we would have paid much more had we not been on a Singapore Airlines package but, irrespective, we thought this hotel was extremely good value for what we paid, and the perfect location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mela1963
Reviews.Content: As singapore is not the cheapest city, this hotel was well located within walking distrance to clark quay, chinatown and MRT. Hotel is your average 3 star. Had not problems with this hotel. Hotel does have a laundry which has one washing machine and dryer for guests to use at a small fee which is great when travelling with at family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Superior rooms good value, executive rooms overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kiara_renee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property twice within a 2 week time frame, as I had to travel to Singapore for business. The hotel is in China town, and is very conveniently located accross the road from a metro station. Singapore's metro system is very easy to use, and so efficient! The hotel itself is fairly non descript- pleasant enough, but nothing you would be bowled over by. The first time, I stayed in a superior room. For a 4 star hotel in Singapore, it is quite well priced, and I quite liked the location. The included breakfast was wonderful, with lots of variety. The room was clean, modern, and everything I needed. The next time (2 weeks later), I upgraded the room to an Executive room. Aside from being on a higher floor with a better view, the actual room was identical. We had access to the executive lounge, which had a cocktail hour, plus canapes. However what they meant by "cocktails", is that they have 4 bottles of spirits in a corner, which you can pour yourself, into cans of softdrink, which you also pour yourself. Not really my definition of a cocktail! The snacks they served were good though, and they would just keep bringing them out, so you could almost get away with just that for dinner. We did also have the option of eating in the executive lounge, which we did do the first day- but it basically was just food brought in from the buffet, which took longer, and was therefore colder by the time you received it, so we just ate at the buffett after that. Overall, I was happy with the hotel, but I don't feel that the upgrade was worth the expense, and I wouldn't do it again if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: so_mei
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Clean, modern and cosy. Well located in City center of Singapore. Closed to everything. Good service. Will defitely recommend it. You'll need to pay for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joybell27
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from our second stay at the Furama City Centre having previously stayed here in March 2008. On arrival we were upgraded to a renovated room on the fourth floor. The room had a very spacious bathroom with a huge tub and a very large walk in shower. We had a comfortable king size bed and enough storage space. The room was an odd shape, not rectangular, and the way that it was configured you almost walked into the bathroom when you opened the door from the hall. We did not use the swimming pool which is located on the sixth floor but when we had a look it was extremely windy up there. The thing that we like most about this hotel is the location. We love China Town and Clark Quay and they are both a short walk away. The China Town station is just across the road and the SIA bus stop is very close so it is really easy to get around. There was no free WiFi only paid internet however there was a much cheaper internet café five minutes walk away. This is a comfortable property and we would be happy to stay here again in the future however, more and more we are looking at staying in hotels that provide free internet and this is becoming a deal breaker for us.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night in a superior room in November, 2010. I booked the stay through Asiatravel where they had a reasonable rate which was also offered directly by the hotel. Generally, it was a very disappointing stay. I had previously stayed here a number of nights over the years but the room on this occasion was different, supposedly renovated but it actually seemed to be less pleasing than the rooms on previous visits, which were a number of years ago. The check-in was alright and the attendant seemed to be friendly but there seemed to be a bit of backchat or enquiries going between the reception staff after the check-in. The porter arrived with the luggage quite quickly after I had arrived in the room and I just wasn’t happy with his attitude from the outset. Firstly, he asked me where I was from, which was fine. Then, upon hearing the answer, he lightened and made a remark about how he thought I looked as if I was from the People’s Republic of China and he made it seem as if there was a problem with that. Then, I gave him a tip and then he made a remark that it was only $2, so then I gave him another $2 so he was happy and left. The lobby itself wasn’t large or grand but it was alright. Unfortunately, throughout my stays here, I always remember the lobby as being quite crowded and there usually isn’t a place to sit down so that’s something that I think the hotel needs to consider. During this stay, the hotel seemed crowded. Unfortunately, i wasn’t allocated a good room and that was quite disappointing, considering the room rate of $S170 nett not incl. breakfast. The room had no view at all and seemed to be quite small. Looking at the plan of the room on the fire escape diagram on the door, it looked to be about the smallest room of those they had available on that level and I wasn’t sure what I had done to deserve such a room allocation. The room itself, apart from its size, also did not impress. It didn’t seem to be well-designed and I’ll get to the details of that later. The carpet was dark, it was worn and didn’t look to be very clean. It seemed as if there was an attempt to make the room appear stylish but, in fact, the room was quite poorly designed. First of all, I had quite major problems in the bathroom. The bath took a very long time to fill if the water was allowed to go through the bath tap normally. It was only after the cap/plug was pulled (which was on top of the bath tap and normally just diverts the water flow from the tap to the shower and vice versa except the tap here didn’t have a shower) that the water ‘flowed’ with sufficient strength to fill the bath in a reasonable amount of time. Actually, the water did not flow but spluttered out and made a mess of the bath and also started to fill the floor. It was necessary to just stand there pulling this cap while trying to contain the mess on the bathroom floor. I filmed this aspect of the bath and the video is on my Youtube page (http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms). Realistically, the bath would have taken almost half an hour to fill if left to fill through the tap. Also, it seemed as if the bath could not be secured properly through the stop and was leaking a little water and that would have prolonged the process of filling the bath. While the bath tap was running, it was not really possible to adjust the temperature of the water. Instead, pulling the plug/cap enabled the adjustment to be made but if the water was allowed to flow through the tap normally, then the temperature would not be correct. The tiles in the bathroom also appeared to be medium-slippery, while they were still probably safe, they did not prevent a small slip in either direction before halting the slide. It was difficult to find a resting position in the bath itself, it wasn’t comfortable by any means. My bath was also not free-standing, unlike in some of the photos which appear on Tripadvisor, where the room category may be different. Generally, my room didn’t look as pleasing as the photos on Tripadvisor for this property and I suspect that’s because I was not allocated a good room. The difficulties in the bathroom didn’t end there. While it was nice that there was a rainshower available, the problem was that the water droplets were too large and hence the shower wasn’t really comfortable. The sink itself was located close to the door and I wasn’t too sure about this design either, as I use quite a noisy shaver which might actually cause noise pollution if placed near the door. Other aspects of the room also disappointed. There was a musty smell upon entering the room and I wasn’t sure if that was caused by the aircon. The aircon itself was quite loud at night but it was powerful and the room didn’t appear to be stuffy. The bed itself had a yellow stain and upon seeing this, I wondered whether this room was actually allocated only for a specific purpose. The room was noisy, soundproofing really wasn’t very good. The sounds of other bathroom drains were obvious, loud and strong throughout the night. There just seemed to be water gushing through by the sound of it. The iron was not of a high quality and didn’t seem to work well, it couldn’t achieve the task of flattening shirts. The TV was the only positive aspect of the room, as it was large and of a good quality backed up by a wide channel selection. I was so disappointed by the room compared to what it appeared like on previous visits that I went to the reception desk to ask about their wood-panelled rooms and whether it was possible to stay in one of those instead. The reception member just didn’t seem able or willing to give a straight answer and waffled on about how some of the rooms were Superior-category and didn’t have any views, which was not an issue I mentioned in the first place, as I was only talking about the previous-style wood-panelled rooms. Then, she talked about how the rooms with views were on higher floors and they were deluxe rooms. However, the hotel website as of date of writing and of booking did show superior rooms with a view and also with the wood-panelled design and her long-winded answer which didn’t address any points directly was clearly made to ensure that I stayed put. She also seemed to be quite practised in her response and its delivery. I do, however, get the feeling that the rate I paid should have qualified at least for a room with some view, even if of the lobby. Generally, the standard of construction just wasn’t there and as mentioned, the functionality was also not of a level associated with the usual brand names. I’m not sure who the hotel engaged to design the rooms but their level of knowledge and expertise clearly doesn’t compare to any of the established brands. The location of the hotel in Chinatown was quite a strong point and the hotel is close to an MRT station but that’s often the case with hotels in Singapore. The best that could be said of the check-out experience was that the staff member did her job. Prior to the checkout, the housekeeping staff member rang my doorbell at about 11am a few times. When I went outside and asked why the two staff members rung the doorbell, since the check-out time was noon, the housekeeping staff member couldn’t provide an answer because she didn’t speak much English and she just said: OK, OK. The other staff member was engaged on her handphone and couldn’t be bothered to break that engagement to provide an answer. Overall, this was quite a disappointing stay and it was very unfortunate because I remember that I had much better stays here prior to this one. Previously, I would have given the hotel four stars but on the evidence of this visit, it only deserves two. NOTE: You can find videos of the hotel room on my youtube page at http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good room, dispointing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DamerManchester
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Furama City for 3 nights during my short stay in Singapore. It was recomended by a relative. After arriving on an early morning flight they allowed be to use shower facilities and pool to freshen up. Normal check is supposed to be 2pm but they allowed be to have my room from 10am, great to catch up on sleep, even better because I got a free upgrade to an Executive Room. Room was very clean, though twin beds a bit odd. Bathroom very spacious. The hotel is in a great location for exploring China Town and close to MRT. My only dissapointment was the breakfast which in my opinion was not of great quality or variety.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round value”
Reviews.Author: Whitebird4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located, walking distance to the river, Clarks Quay, Colier Quay, and next door to China town. Good breakfast and and high standard of cleanliness. We would definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, basic, operational - OK for bussiness.”
Reviews.Author: OneOzzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because my employer put me there. There was some sort of deal done to make it attractive for the business rather than the resident. The room was clean & comfortable with a good sized and functioning LCD TV. The channels available gave a good mix of English, Chinese & Indonesian language channels. The bathroom was clean, well stocked, with a good shower. The breakfast provided was adequate, but uninspiring. Because of this we didn’t eat any other meals at the hotel. A short walk to Clerk Quay gave access to a variety of good restaurants. Given a choice, I would have rather stayed close to Orchard Road, which was a train or taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Good place close to city”
Reviews.Author: harrynaik
Reviews.Content: value for Money, i got a good rate on the internet using the lowest rate for the day offer. Good 4-star hotel facilities and best is it is walking distance from Chinatown , Clarke Quay which are the busiest places in the evenings in singapore for Shopping and clubbing.

Reviews.Title: “High Cost Performance”
Reviews.Author: DaiChen
Reviews.Content: You should select Exective Club which plan include light meal & snack at 1st floor. You can offset the difference of rate if you could have a quick dinner before drinking.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable place to rest at night”
Reviews.Author: drydenofasturia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Furama City Center for four nights in September 2010. The hotel is extremely well located, right on the edge of Chinatown, walking distance (10-15 minutes) from Boat and Clarke Quays, and one block from the Chinatown MRT (subway) stop. The room (a "deluxe" room on the fourth floor) was pleasant and sunny, with a window overlooking a terrace, and was kept spotlessly clean. It was also reasonably priced for Singapore. On the downside were a bunch of small things that keep me from giving the hotel an unqualified recommendation: the corridors smelled musty, the level of english comprehension at the front desk was relatively poor, there was a major elevator outage during my stay (which is a serious issue in a hotel of this size), my key cards didn't work one day for no apparent reason, the air conditioning was rather finicky, and the hotel required a payment to guarantee an early morning taxi to the airport. In other words, the this is clearly not a five-star hotel. In sum, I give the Furama a qualified recommendation: it's a good choice if you just want somewhere to rest your head at night while visiting Singapore, but it's not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service, Tired Rooms, Enjoyed Location”
Reviews.Author: stkildatram
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with family member and booked a room each rather than share a twin room. I requested 1 large bed for each of us . On arrival the hotel service was slow, impersonal and they did not want to provide us with this request. They wanted to offload their single/twin rooms and were not concerned that we were paying double or that a double room had been reserved. The rooms are dated and need some renovations. They also charge too much for internet access which is often provided free of charge at many hotels. The location is good with access to Chinatown and transport. Stay there for the location but not for any smiles or great service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for China Town”
Reviews.Author: tiggeroo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Furama for 4 nights and loved it. Having arrived from London after a long flight we were given a free upgrade when our double room was not ready on time - something that the reception staff were so apologetic for, even though we only had to wait a couple of hours and didn't really mind. All the staff were very polite but also friendly, particularly the doormen who were only too happy to run out into the road to stop a taxi for you! Our room was very modern and absolutely spotless - we were a bit concerned by the glass walled bathroom but were relieved when we found it could be sectioned off with a curtain! The only fault I could find was perhaps a lack of storage space for clothes etc. but as we were only there for 4 nights we didn't mind living out of our suitcases and there was adequare room for clothing that needed to be hung up (plus an iron and ironing board if needed). The hotel was ideally located on the edge of China Town which was so busy and vibrant - quite a contrast to the modern side of Singapore. However, we were only a 10 minute walk away from Clarke Quay. The Furama was almost opposide a metro station and also on the City Sightseeing Tour bus route so getting around was no problem at all. We ate out most nights in China Town as it was a lot cheaper than the restaurants in Clarke Quay and the bars had Tiger Beer on special offer in most places. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"New Concept" open bathrooms - No Privacy Allowed”
Reviews.Author: BangkokFlyer
Reviews.Content: The designer who sold the Furama City Centre on the "new concept" rooms should be (fill in the blank). 1) If you like privacy when using the toilet, forget it. The entire toilet, bathtub and shower is behind clear glass. Yes, there is a partial shade, which really doesn't leave much to the imagination!. If you are travelling on your honeymoon, you may not need any privacy, but if you are travelling with family, friends, colleague expect them to watch everything you do in the bathroom and you will see everything they do. 2) A further problem is that if someone uses the bathroom during the night, turning on the bathroom light is the same as turning on the light in the entire bedroom. Evidently, I was the first guest (according to the manager) who didn't like this open bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Located close to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: austandtheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-July. Size of room was smaller than the Landmark Hotel which we had justed moved from. The extra bed was a roller away which made the normal double bed room smaller. We stayed here for 3 nights but the bottled water was missed being replaced on the second day. Our room was on the 7th floor, out of 22nd so the view was great but surprisingly there was no road noise. Entrance to hotel is at the back in a side street. Walking to the main Chinatown was easy as there is a connecting overpass from the hotel to next shopping centre. Check-in and check-out were both quick and easy. Friendly staff, especially the cleaning staff. Reasonable size pool but in a strange location as you get off on the 6th floor then walk down the fire stairs to the pool on the 5th floor. The gym is also located on this floor. There is no direct access from the 5th floor. Didn’t eat in the hotel as we ate in the many food stalls within Chinatown. There is a Macdonalds and Subway in Chinatown Point across the road if you need it. Location was good for walking and exploring Chinatown, Clarke Quay and Boat Quay.
