The Chinatown MRT station is close by. Marble bathroom was mostly clean except for mould in the grout which we found in all hotels in Singapore. Air conditioner in room was noisy. Carpet needed a good clean and the selection of TV channels was poor. Overall I would recommend this hotel to explore the Chinatown area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KarkiA
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded at no extra charge, Hotel has definately in easy location, (MRT very nearby which is the strongest point) Service is prompt, you can experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and were upgraded to a room with a king size bed, which was greatly appreciated. The staff were friendly and helpful also. Our bedroom and bathroom was spacious and clean. As our room was facing the supreme court and not Eu Tong Sen street, it was incredibly quiet. The air-conditioning worked very well and was appreciated after being out on the streets of Singapore. The buffet breakfast was a disappointment and since this hotel is located in the heart of Chinatown - omit the buffet breakfast option with this hotel and head elsewhere instead. The swimming pool, though small, is a welcome relief from the heat and humidity. This hotel is well-serviced by two MRT stations on the circle line (Chinatown and Clark Quay respectively) - heading down to Orchard Road is very quick! I will certainly recommend this hotel for its affordable hotel rates in an ideal location!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and horrible room!”
Reviews.Author: nic036
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is currently under refurbishment and as we found out the whole hotel smells like paint and it was very hard to breathe. It would have been good to have a window in our room. Although they said we were upgraded to a deluxe i would of hated to see what a superior room was! Our sheets were dirty and had stains all over them and there was hair in the bed when we were going to sleep. We could here all the pipes running through the night so it was very loud and hard to sleep. We were able to see a room with a window and it did look very nice. The only good point about this hotel was the location. I will not stay there again until refurbishments are completed, i may consider it due to convenince of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: KennyClarkson
Reviews.Content: We were travelling round the world for our honeymoon, when in Singapore we had two nights to kill before our train to Kuala Lumpur. Luckily we got this deal very last minute on a website. Our room was fantastic, I think it was one of the recently refurbished rooms with a clear walled bathroom etc. Location was superb just in China town.

Reviews.Title: “Only location, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: MichaelFengHn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week and there will be no reason for me to back this hotel next time. First impression I arrived with full luggage, nobody care, no greetings, no smile. Hotel hall is small, even smaller than a 2-3 stars hotel. The feeling seems like you come to a hostel. Room - Not well appointed. Basin is in-room, nearby the door. Water may be spread out after you wash your hands, face. The other thing is power switches, if you want to turn on/off the lights you have to walk around the room. - Please be careful with basin, I accidentally dropped a glass into it during brushing my teeth and the basin was cracked (but the glass was still okay). I had to pay 200S$ penalty. - It seems no warm water in shower. Cleanliness At first, the room was clean like other hotel. One day I had a towel with a little bit smelly. I guess that hotel staff simply check by eyes and return the towel to right place. After this time, I had to rush water to towel to make sure it will be replaced in next day. Other The most disappointed thing is the lift. There are 4 lifts but they are divided into 2 groups working separatedly and on 2 of the lifts you may not know they are going up or down except you enter it. You have to click buttons on both sides in order to get lift fast (according to hotel note). I had to get used to with "out of service" status of the lift. In the last day I stayed there, only one lift worked. I could not imagine that there is a such kind "4-star" hotel like Furama City Centre. Only good thing is the location, it is easy to find, near MRT, China town, business area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rebeccakakakakaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the MTR station. Although it looks old, but the room is nice. Besides, it is near the Chinatown, it is very convenience to buy sounevir. The view from my room is nice too. I can see the Ferris Wheel ^^ The buffet breakfast was good. full of variety and taste good ~

Reviews.Title: “Good value very interesting location”
Reviews.Author: austravelth
Reviews.Content: One of Singapore's reasonably priced hotels in the very interesting Chinatown area. I ate one of the best Yum Cha meals ever nearby. A little rumbly with the train going underneath sometimes but overalll good service and good value. Ask for high room. Will return for sure as some of the other Singapore hotels are way overpriced. Would be nice to have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a good location but look so old!”
Reviews.Author: kibibo
Reviews.Content: I bookede this hotel because the price was not that expensive compare to other hotels in Singapore and the hotel is near to two MRT stations; Clark Quay and China Town. There are also many famous restaurants and some old chinese shopping centers nearby. The hotel building look so old. It only looked good at night. The decoration around the lobby is not up to date. Inside the room was okay but a bit small. The extra bed was too soft and caused backpain. The hotel breakfast was not so special.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Business Districts - No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RajeevThakkar
Reviews.Content: Furama City Centre is very close to Business District, very close to MRT and very convenient, it has everything necessary for a business traveller. The Hotel is old but well maintained, some rooms might have still give you a feeling of old paint and accessories.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights to attend a workshop due to the good rates they quoted. We wanted to stay in another hotel, but we decided to book here due to the attractive price. The hotel is near Chinatown and the MRT. There is a shopping center right beside the hotel, but this is not a high-end mall. The room I was assigned was clean and functional, and the bathroom was good. The TV is an old CRT type, but I did not watch much anyway. I was given free internet access since this is included in our corporate account. The people in reception were friendly and breakfast was adequate. We had breakfast early in the morning so we always had plenty of tables and chairs to choose from. The only complaint I had was I requested for a king/queen bed, but I got two singles joined together.

Reviews.Title: “Overall quite dissappointing and no more than 3-star”
Reviews.Author: EurasiaVoyager
Reviews.Content: okay, Singapore is an expensive place and will always be, so I thought I got a got deal when booking this one on a lastminute-booking-website. location is good, very near to Chinatown, though you have to walk through a busy shopping complex to reach the MTR-station, which can be quite a hassle with a lot of luggage in case u want to avoid a more expensive taxi trip. Lobby is on the first floor, not at the basement. check the room they assign u first, and if u don't like it, go back downstairs and ask for another room ! they seem to have a tendency to assign the worst rooms first and then see if the guest agrees or complains. particularly, if u book the room at a favourable rate. The first room I was given had the size of a shoebox, plus it was located right next to the noisy elevator shaft, and I would not even give that room 3-stars ! that was 2-2,5 stars maybe ! I then complained and they gave me another room, which had twin bed instead of Queen bed, but at least it was slightly bigger. the interior is very dated and definitely NOT worth more than 3-stars. the carpet very worn and not clean, almost disgusting. the only nice thing was the bathroom, which could easily be rated 4-stars and had obviously be renovated not long ago. But as they rate themselves on the several booking websites as "4,5-stars", I must say: that's a good joke. maybe the few "executive rooms" they have are worth that ranking, but the rest is just dated 3-star quality. the breakfast was included in my room-rate, but oh my god ! that relatively small coffeeshop had to serve 445 rooms ! you had to queue to get a table, no, not a table, just a seat, joining someone else's table, but that's fine. they squeezed as many tables as possible in that coffeeshop which made the entire atmosphere extremely unpleasant, you could baerely walk between all those tables and chairs. I wonder how the staff can work under such conditions on a daily basis. staff itself at the coffeeshop was friendly nevertheless and they were well organized, Kudos to them, and the quality as well as the variety of food was quite okay. but I am not used to have my breakfast in an atmosphere that resembles KL's Puduraya Bus-station two days before Hari Raya. would I recommend this hotel to anyone? honestly, only if you can manage to get a VERY favourable rate or if you have the strong desire to stay in the middle of Chinatown, otherwise, better stay somewhere else, particularly as this is one of those hotels which charges extra for internet (25 S$ per day).

Reviews.Title: “View from a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: Affe
Reviews.Content: This review is based on wheelchair accessibility (except rating). LOCATION For eateries, Chinatown is pretty close (around 10 minutes on foot). All sidewalks in Singapore have ramps. COMMON AREAS The entrance is via a secondary door, with lift (regular guests will use the escalator). All hotel areas are accessible. The swimming pool is accessible via service areas. ROOM (smoking non-handicap room no. 808) The room we were given had both bathtub (that can be moved towards the glass wall, as we did, to have more space) and shower (we were provided a plastic chair). The shower was large enough to use it. The bathtub is high, deep and not very stable. STAFF HELPFULNESS Very low. It was not clear if they handicap rooms or not. I guess they just have rooms. The day before our stay we visited a room that suited our needs perfectly and had a wonderful view, and we were assured that the following day we would be given that exact room. We specified clearly that another room might not have been suitable for us. But the following day they said that that room was not available and suggested several other rooms (where the bathroom was not accessible and, besides, they had no view at all). After more than one hour we were reluctantly shown a room that suited our needs. At the reception, we were said that the swimming pool was not accessible; I saw myself another access and I asked the pool attendant, and he showed us the way via the service areas. We asked for a plastic chair to take a chair and after one hour we got a very dirty chair from the swimming pool. It seemed as if they had never had wheelchair guests. GENERAL RATING (not related to accessibility) Excellent if you are given a room like the one we got and do not have specific needs. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dessii
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Furama for a total of 2 weeks. Brilliant location, right in Chinatown, close to MRT, walking distance to River, Central Business district. Hotel lobby is a little dated, rooms are not very large, but good standard for Singapore. Daily internet charges are S$25, so a little steep. A better option is upgrading to executive status (S$ 58 per day), which includes a nicer room on a higher floor, unlimited internet, breakfast buffet served in private executive lounge, coffee & tea in lounge all day, cocktails and snacks in the lounge in the evenings. Free internet and breakfast are worth the money alone and by enjoying a pre-dinner drink & snacks we kept our bar bills low. The Executive staff also can not do enough for you - very helpful and can't do enough for you. Experienced small problems with the water temperature in the room (going hot and cold), but other than that a fab hotel at a very competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “No mosquitoes in Singapore..........”
Reviews.Author: LiamMcG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central position and I found the staff very helpful, smiley and friendly. I was amazed to read what KFilip from Belgrade wrote about mosquitoes in reception. The reception area of the hotel is spotless. I was interested , while visiting friends in Singapore, that mosquitoes are Not Allowed. The city employs teams of foggers who spray parks and gardens, as well as pools, to prevent the mossies from accumulating. (We were amazed to see them spraying the Botanical Gardens!) Furthermore, heavy fines are imposed by tthe Giovernment if mossied are found on any premises - private or public. My only suggestion would be to take advantage of the breakfast- great choice and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “better around if you search sites”
Reviews.Author: andyoz
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic, right in China Town, MRT very close. Booked Superior Room after viewing pics and various sites. Check in efficient, no waiting. Room was a disappointment. Tiny room I felt like I was back in Japan. I guess Furama is Japanese. I know there are larger rooms, you just have to look at the fire escape plan on the door which maps the rooms. I got the smallest room on the floor. No luck in changing unless I was willing to pay another $70 ++. Room adequate though and clean and quiet, did not hear a sound night or day. Bed is very hard but slept ok, carpet is worn. Bathroom very old. Shower over narrow tub you almost have to stand sideways, great water pressure though. In room internet S$25/24hrs, standard price for hotels so wasn't blown away by that. Must say the restaurant looked busy all the time so obviously popular. For me location was key but their sister hotel Furama River Front (which doesn't front a river) is a better choice and only a few minutes taxi away. I clicked no I wouldn't recommend only because of the room I had, maybe larger rooms are better. Thats my personal vote going on this particular room.

Reviews.Title: “mosquitoes”
Reviews.Author: KFilip
Reviews.Content: hotel have good location in China Town, very easy to move around... but, i waited for check in for 1 hour, i still do not understand what was the problem... rooms are ok, my room was on 12th floor, with great panoramic view. Lobby bar is packed with mosquitoes, i was really eaten alive while was waiting there. i booked my stay in that hotel since it was only available (made late booking) but if you are not in same position, for same or less price you can get much better quality.

Reviews.Title: “For us not a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleSussex
Reviews.Content: My wife and l have stayed in several hotels in Singapore, and we found the staff at this hotel never had a smile, and weren't very helpful. Will not here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: autumnfairy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night. The room was clean and the size was pretty big. I mean, with the amount of money I paid, it's a good deal. It was facing the city and a bit of Singapore river, so I like it quite much. I applaud the cleanliness and location as MRT station was only around 5 minutes leisure walk. However, to me, the internet was really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: hotelboats
Reviews.Content: After a bad hotel in Bali, it was wonderful to be greated with the words 'we have upgraded you'! The room was well appointed - you soon got used to the glassed in bathroom... The location is very good, with China Town and food street only 10 mins walk away. Did not eat in the hotel - too busy exploring eating outside. Staff very friendly and the hotel looked clean and welcoming. Don't know about other hotels in Singapore, but the Furama was good enough for me and I will stay there again - I have my own 4 star hotel in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “HAPPY WITH ROOM AFTER INITIAL HICCUP”
Reviews.Author: Princessbrisbane
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 4 nights. We were initially given a room on the 7th floor. The room was very large, but when we pulled the curtains back, we were faced with a gutter and roof. Had we be staying 1 night, we would not have worried, however 4 nights was a different story. I went down to reception and asked for another room. The little madam told me there were no other rooms available. So we decided to check-out, and surprise, surprise, a room on the 13th floor materialized. This was smaller, but it was fine by us, and the view was spectacular. We enjoyed our stay immensely. We had just got off a cruise, so most of our clothes needed a good wash, a self serve washing machine and drier was provided, although they charge like "Wounded Bulls" but we were grateful for the service. We did not eat in the hotel, no need, as just across the street was a food hall. BE WARNED, THE BEDS ARE AS HARD AS CONCRETE.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Key!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkSR
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a very central location. Yes it is expensive but by Singapore standards it is actually reasonable value considering the location. Rooms are of an exceptional standard, clean and the service immaculate. Front desk staff could not be more friendly or helpful However, I will say avoid eating there and avoid the internet; it costs a fortune. There is a pretty decent internet cafe about 3mins walk up the street for a fraction of what you would pay in the hotel; also there are several inexpensive decent places to eat within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible all the way stay well clear”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers62
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible the staff where very rude when asked a question they didnt know english to . They put us ina very small room the toilet rocked and banged everytime we used it. The bed was 4 steps from the bath room. The tv faced towards the door and we had no chair except the bed which was facing the window over looking the front desk lights on all night. When i asked to be moved was told i didnt pay for any other upgrade once i returned my travel agent found out i had paid for better room and was told we will look in to in thats almost 12 months ago and not a thing except sorry for bad staff there getting counciled for better people skills. My advice stay well away from there. PLease

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: layang-kangen
Reviews.Content: Location location. the location makes it worth it to stay at this hotel. room is decent. food, dont bother. and yes, the rate for internet is ridicolous. service is cold and impersonal. but what can I say, the location is so convenient. minutes away from MRT and shopping malls. intercontinental bugis would be my 2nd choice if I want to splurge, but if I am looking for budget deal, I'll go to Furama.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lovely room, good location”
Reviews.Author: JulieOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over a weekend in a delux room. Room was lovely, great shower and bath area , no noise so was easy to sleep. We had a very pleasant stay. Had breakfast on one of the days and there was a large selection of hot and cold foods. Not sure about chicken bacon tho...give that one a miss :-) They have an outdoor pool on the 6th floor. Wouldn't use the spa (not well kept) but was happy with being able to leave our bags there after a 12noon check out and return to freshen up in the shower room before flying out. Staff were friendly also. They have smoking and non-smoking rooms so make sure you request non-smoking if that's your preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PrimusGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in mid-October. Hotel is in a great location, right in Chinatown, and easy walking distance to Clarke Quay. We were in a standard room on the 8th floor, had beautiful views of Singapore, including the Singapore flyer. Room & bathroom were nice, had everything you need. Hotel staff were all friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keefw
Reviews.Content: The main reason for staying at the Furama has to be the location which is absolutely great for the Chinatown eating/shopping area and it's convient location to the MRT station.The wife and i just love the area and this was our second visit to the Furama this year. The hotel itself is a good standard 3 star establishment in pretty good condition.The rooms being a reasonable size with a great bed and good facilities.Fairly good pool pool but unfortunately some maintenance work going on when we were there.Breakfast was so so but after the 1st day we decided to skip this and eat out where there are so many different options at far cheaper prices. For the last 2 nights of our 8 day holiday we moved out as prices doubled for the Singapore Grand Prix and went to the Airport Crowne Plaza which was far superior and a better price. All in all a pretty good hotel in a great location but much preferred the Crown Plaza which was only a 40 minute ride on the efficient SMRT.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms,OK location”
Reviews.Author: sleepi321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Check-in took a very long time, however, we were given a free upgrade to a deluxe room, which made up for it! Rooms: The deluxe room was spacious and clean. As someone mentioned previously, the beds are very comfortable. My room was facing the singapore flier area, which was wonderful in the night! The only problem with our room was that the safe was not working, however I just hid most of the valuables around the room and the problem was sorted out after we left. Location: Not so convenient if you wish to be in the Orchard Rd area, however the Chinatown MRT is literally across the road, so it's not too much of a hassle. Clarke Quay is approx a 10 min walk from the hotel, so there are lots of restaurants and shops nearby. I didn't stay in the hotel long enough to rate interactions with staff, however it was perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: PeonyThailand
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very near an MRT station, within a walking distance to restaurants on the Clark Quay and Robertson Quay. Based on the reviews on tripadvisor, it seems that the hotel has different types of rooms. We stayed in one of the newly-renovated ones. The room is stylish, clean, and has the most comfortable bed. The bed was so comfortable that we actually woke up around noon everyday (and still didn’t want to get out of bed!). The curtain also completely blocked out the light. However, I must point out the most peculiar thing about the room we stayed in. The bathroom's walls are actually made of see-through glass (not kidding, I couldn't believe it when I saw it the first time). There is a shade/curtain provided for the wall between the bed and bathroom but unfortunately it still didn't give enough privacy. The other wall is without any shades. There is a foggy strip running through the glass wall but you can still see the person in side anyway. It's probably great if you travel alone and stay here. However, if you are going to stay here with someone, make sure that you are absolutely comfortable with this person!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Neo_Fung
Reviews.Content: It is just 5 min walk to the MRT station (China Town) and is located nearby the China Town main shopping area. It is just a few minute walk to two main food court building. Yet the room is a bit small and the hotel is a bit ageing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: N0rthey
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was one of the cheapest in Singapore, so wasn't expecting much, however the hotel was amazing. It is in a great location in Chinatown, and you can walk to most of the attractions/ shops (although the MRT station is only next door). The reception staff were very helpful, and check in was great. I had a room upgrade to the Dulux room, which was absolutely stunning, bathroom and in room facilities were great. The swimming pool was probably the only let down, as this was not staffed when I was there and was a little unkempt, but I guess this hotel is in the city centre so most people don't use the pool! All round, a great hotel - I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best rate in Singapore, however service is not upto the mark”
Reviews.Author: Chandramohan T
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good, rooms are excellent. Good value for the price we pay in Singapore. I would not rate this as the best in terms of service as the room service number kept on ringing and nobody picked up. I had to remind 3,4 times to the reception for an adapter. Located in the centre of the city near the china town. Not suitable for people who would like to have Indian food as this is quite far from Little India.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Business Conference. A beautiful hotel. Very near to China Town - a different culture for us. Good and spacious rooms. A very good Restaurant. Good Service. Surely recommendable Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Odd bathrooms, but a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mteq
Reviews.Content: We (a party of 2 parents and 3 grown up or growing children in 2 rooms) visited this hotel during late May for 2 nights. The hotel is located adjacent to the Chinese area, and its easy enough to find using the subway system. There are lots of places in which to eat nearby, and also lots of shops, etc. in the immediate vicinity. The hotel entrance is spacious and large. There is a bar and sitting area in the lobby, and the main restaurant leads off. We had 2 rooms; a twin and a triple. The triple looked out into the hotel lobby (from the the 4th floor). The room was of good size, clean and well decorated. The bathroom was large and well equipped, but had no wash sink in it - the sink was located in the bedroom. This worked, but wasn't ideal in our view. The third bed was a portable, and less comfortable than the other beds. The double bedroom looked out towards the rear of the hotel, and had a balcony (which we couldn't access). The room was well prepared, quite spacious and had a pleasant modern feel to it. The only problem we had with the room was that the bathroom was enclosed in a glass walled room - very modern no doubt, but rather disconcerting to find the other occupant of the room could see you showering, bathing or using the toilet! Admittedly there was a blind to pull down on one wall, but it did little for my sense of modesty!!! The wash sink was (as in the other room) located in the room rather than in the bathroom. For some people the bathroom issue may be a trivial issue; for others it may be critical. The breakfast was of a good standard with lots of choice of both western and eastern food. We left on the day of our departure at 0630, but the breakfast service was fully staffed and complete at that time. Wifi internet was available at a price, and there were pay Internet terminals in the lobby. The bed rooms also had a high speed cable. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, Our impressions of this hotel were positive: the location, and its general ambiance was attractive and pleasant. The only problem I would identify related to the 'glass walled' bathroom which for some people would be an attraction, and for others a strong negative.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but fine”
Reviews.Author: SheilasWheels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is looking a bit tired, but it does the job and if the price is right you can't complain. The room was fine, and clean, bathroom probably in need of a refurb. If you ask for a city view room, you get great views towards the Singapore Flyer. Hotel is located in Chinatown, close to a subway station. Its also close enough to walk to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. There's a small pool - but its FREEZING! Staff pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: anyad
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop in our RTW trip and we had a nice stay at the Furama City Centre. We loved the fact that the hotel was close to Chinatown and also to the MRT and also close to Clarke Quay which has some fantastic restaurants and bars. The first room we were assigned on arrival was not suitable for the 3 of us, pull out bed, and a not very nice room, so we rang down to the front desk and complained and they moved us to a much better room with 2 queen beds. Apart from that, everything else we couldn't fault. Lovely breakfast...great surrounds and Singapore is a great place with such a lot to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zhayynn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took her father for a holiday to Singapore and we stayed at the Furama City Centre. The staff were very friendly and were kind enough to allow us an early check-in for one room. The hotel is located right next to Chinatown and is a 15 minute walk to Clarke Quay. The locality has lots of shopping and is quite busy though the hotel itself is tucked away just off the main road. The lobby looked quite dated, byt the rooms were a surprising contrast with a modern minimalist approach. Service was not great as we found out when we requested extra pillows and had to call them twice to remind them. What was worse was that the next day the housekeeping staff removed the extra pillow and w had to go through the same drama all over again. The food was excellent, but my wife and father-in-law found the going tough as there were few vegetarian options. The frosted glass toilet doors are a bad idea, considering that in our room, the WC was right in line with the door! The staff were very helpful and are an asset to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore bash”
Reviews.Author: jmon72
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is easily accessable and in the centre of the city. The Food and hospitality are excellent. Their care for occupants are commendable. we can get a good view of singapore from this hotel. Also Chinese Mall and Indian malls are all very near this hotel .. We get easy access to taxi and metro rails.

Reviews.Title: “OK value for money but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Princesssazzle
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed by this hotel. Overall I can't complain too much, as we did get a good deal for the room and it is quite conveniently located for ChinaTown. However it smelled bad and the staff were not friendly. We asked to have a taxi reserved for an early departure, but the staff forgot to call. When we came down, the bell boy at the entrance told me to go stand on the street and call one myself! Our room had just been redone, but I thought it was done rather cheaply. (It did look good though). Overall I thought the hotel felt a bit old. And the swimming pool was not very nice. It had ugly metal railings over the top (permanent railings, not construction ones). One very good point: we arrived at 7 in the morning and they have a shower in the fitness center which we could use before leaving our luggage and visiting the town. However, a few months before I stayed at the Furama Riverfront, it's sister hotel, and preferred that one. The room was clean and we had a nice view. The location is a bit out of the center but 1) there are always taxis in front (not the case of the Furama City Centre) and 2) there are regular buses which go to China Town and Orchard Road in 10 minutes (and the staff helped me with bus numbers etc).

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: Booked on wotif.com for $145 a night. Rooms were well appointed and refurbished. Common areas good. Buffet breakfast was included but was disappointing with no cereals, no decaf and lots of yesterday's food. Good bed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: remittancegirl
Reviews.Content: There is very little wrong with this hotel. The rooms are clean and have all the facilities you would expect from a hotel of this sort - efficient and with very little character or charm. The staff are a little cold and harried, but not unpleasant. You can get internet in your room, but it's not cheap. The biggest problem is that, like many other mid-range Singapore hotels, it is really very overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chinatown location”
Reviews.Author: kendraSolihull
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a two night stopover on our way from Australia to the UK. We chose this hotel as it was reasonably priced compared to many, and we wanted to stay near Chinatown, having stayed on Orchard Road previously. We found this hotel a little dated, but it completely met our requirements. Our room on the seventh floor was not renovated, but was perfectly clean and tidy, and more importantly, very quiet - we were tired on arrival having travelled from North Queensland. Check in was easy, the staff were friendly. The chap who brought out luggage to the room was surprised when we gave him a tip. We enjoyed having a nightcap during happy hour in the bar, served by very friendly and pleasant staff. In fact we felt that the staff here were extremely friendly and helpful, and the ubiquitous Singapore Sling was about a quarter the price of those we drank at Raffles We left our luggage in the hotel on our last day as we did not need to be at the airport until 10pm, there was no charge for this service and we were not charged anything for having a taxi called. The MRT was really convenient, and we walked to and from Boat Quay to meet our banker friend for dinner one evening, a short and pleasant walk. We ate wonderful food from the night market in Chinatown and in various food courts, and had a lovely Thai meal on Boat Quay. We also ate in a fab Italian restaurant on Boat Quay with our friend, who wanted to eat a European meal. The bar across the river from Boat Quay had outdoor live music, comfy sofas and expensive wine for our after dinner drinks. We felt the Furama, though a little worn around the edges, was very comfortable and more importantly, within our budget. We will definitely stay here again on our next stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Valencia_janelle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Executive suite of Furama City Centre. Hotel outlook may be a little disappointing but interior atmosphere was pretty good. Check in was done in the executive lounge instead of usual front desk. Quick check in, great service, staff were friendly and spontaneous. Had problems opening the door though due to faulty door system but was settled quickly. Room was above expectation, consist of a mini living room ( with microwave and electronic stove) , a big enough bathroom and the main bedroom. Bed was comfortable, overall layout was modern yet cosy. Has a Dvd player in the room and 2 TV, one in the room and the other at the mini area. Requested for window view of SG flyer and yes, the night view was magnificent. Location wise, Central shopping center was just a road across and a hawker center with really good food just 5 mins walk away. Complimentary Cocktail reception from 6-8 pm and breakfast. Food was average but staff at executive lounge were attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sharonyp
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews of Furama City Centre, we were initially apprehensive about booking a room in this hotel. However, with the exorbitant rates Singapore hotels are charging since my last visit in 2006, this hotel's rates on wotif.com were within our budget. For the same price, I stayed at Swissotel the Stamford in 2006. This time round, we had to settle for Furama City Centre - right in the middle of Chinatown. In all my previous visits to Singapore, I had never set foot in Chinatown! We had no regrets staying at Furama City Centre - it was way beyond our expectations (or rather we didn't have much expectation to begin with). The check-in went on smoothly though the check-in personnel attending to us was not quite fluent in English. The rooms seem to have been refurbished. Though the hotel has been around for some time, the rooms smelled clean - there was no musty smell nor was there any foul sewer smell. The rooms were of decently sized (even for a standard room). The bathroom was also decently sized (big enough to fit a bathtub AND a separate shower cubicle. Breakfast was also decent. We are one lot of very satisfied guests. The parking was complimentary. Even my private banker friend was impressed with the hotel when she visited us in our hotel room! Needless to say, we'll definitely be staying there again. Another friend working in Singapore has already commented that she'll book rooms in the hotel when her family next visits her.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stopover”
Reviews.Author: Joniboy
Reviews.Content: We booked our 2 night stopover here on our way to Australia. 5 of us arrived at 7am on a Monday morning but were checked into a room straight away and were given the next available room within half an hour. The location was fantastic, the rooms were very nice and the buffet breakfast was excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Furama for fools and their money”
Reviews.Author: ranchman32
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many 4-5 star hotels in asia and have never come across a hotel that so thoroughly tries to nickel and dime you, $275/night and the room was ageing badly, stains around the tub, empty mini bar, no room service available at 10:30 at night, arrogant unhelpful staff, no breakfast included, and the kicker that got me, when I checked out they wanted to charge me $5.45, yes thats correct and .45cents for hailing a taxi. Anyone who has ever been to Singapore knows how easy it is to get a taxi. Singapore is the most overpriced city I've ever been in and you come to accept the ludicrous but this place was so ridiculous that I will never forget the bad taste it left in my mouth. I could go on about how unpleasant my stay was but you get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “not recommendable”
Reviews.Author: slimhacky
Reviews.Content: stayed there 2 nights with friends, was not terrible but i would never go there again, i d rather invest a bit more and stay in a first class hotel than to have neither fish nor meat

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ashute
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the newest but when you enter the lobby it is clean and pleasant, the staff are very helpful and check in went without a hitch. They very kindly upgraded us to one of the executive rooms on the top floor which was a great surprise and a good start to our holiday. Beakfast was well run with a good choice of hot and cold food. The hotel is situated near China town and close to Clarke Quay so finding somewhere to eat is no problem, and there are plenty of shops within a 10 minute walk. It is a very good location and only a quick taxi ride to the main shopping areas. I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and enjoyed it although I spent most of my time sightseeing rather than in the room. I booked through Travelocity after reading through the reviews on Tripadvisor. The rate ($124.49 total including taxes and fees) is very fair based on my experience. I was given a room on the 4th floor. Reading other posts, apparently the 4th floor rooms are new and my room looked in very new condition. I did have an outside window but the view is only of some potted plants on the outside ledge. For those reviewers who were stuck on an inside room on the 4th floor, I can say you didn't miss out on much. I think you would have to be on a higher floor to have any decent view. The room would have been small for two but I had plenty of room by myself. As previous reviewers have posted, there is no closet, only drawers and shelfs along with a bar for hangers. Because I was traveling with only small carry-on luggage, this did not pose a problem. Those traveling with large suitcases would find limited space. The room was very clean. All the furnishings were in good shape and looked very new. The bed was very comfortable. There was a flat-panel TV in the room. I was able to recharge my Blackberry without using an adaptor. The sink was located outside the bathroom. As seen in other reviewers' photos, the bathroom is glass-enclosed. The side where you get into the shower stall is only half-covered by glass. It was very difficult not to get water into other parts of the bathroom. This is very similar to other Asian hotels I've stayed. I haven't figured out a way not to get some water outside of the shower stall. The other side of the shower stall is the glass panel facing the room. There is a blind that you can pull down to cover the glass but I noticed that there is enough gap along the side that someone in the room can look in and see you taking a shower. I suppose if you don't mind that's not a big deal. But it can be a bit embarrassing otherwise. Same can be said about sitting on the toilet. There is also a nice large new tub in the bathroom that I did not use. As some others have noted, the room can be damp due to Singapore's humidity. It was hot and humid when I first got in but after blasting the AC it quickly cooled down. I did not encounter any dampness walking barefoot. I did notice that my hand-washed clothes took longer than usual to dry. I used the fitness center on the 5th floor. It's a small room with some light dumbells along with 2 aerobic machines. Luckily there's AC in the room. Around the corner is the outdoor pool and jacuzzi that I did not use but both looked fine. The pool wasn't very big. Being on the 5th floor, there was not much view either. The exterior of the hotel is rather bland. The location is excellent, less than 5 minutes walk to the Chinatown MRT. Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, and Robertson Quay are all within walking distance. Jumping on the MRT will take you just about everywhere. Most people consider Maxwell Food Centre in Chinatown one of the best in Singapore and I certainly agree. I tried about 5-6 different food stalls and stuffed myself. Everything was delicious. It's only about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Singapore's heat would have been bearable if not for the humidity. I found myself looking for the next store with AC every 10-15 minutes. Otherwise, I really enjoyed my visit and my stay at Furama City Centre Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with the Furama City Center”
Reviews.Author: scotbro
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay at Furma City Centre. This was a long weekend family break booked through Expedia for $339USD for 2 adults and a child (4yo) including breakfast for 3 nights. The room was brand new, smelled of paint and could see some fresh drops on the carpet. I think we were the first guests in this fourth floor room. The bad: No window. Makes it difficult to wake in the morning. The good, very comfy bed and big fluffy pillows, a new 40" Samsung Flat screen TV, a fridge, a safe, coffee maker all standard. The room had no closet, only a bar on a wooden shelf. There were two drawers below. Bath had a walk-in glass shower (new), a tub and a toilet. The sink is outside. The air-con was easily controlled. There were many, many lighting options in the room and convenient switches. All in all, a smallish, new, very modern and comfortable room. The walls are thin. The staff in this hotel is EXTREMELY friendly and helpful--all staff. The buffet breakfast was very good with a wide variety of eastern and western food and a great coffee machine. We had an early check-in (11am) and a late check-out (1pm). The pool is nothing special and does not appear purpose built but is ok for a quick dip and some exercise laps. The location of the hotel is a real plus. Easy walk to Clark Quay and to Boat Quay. Also to Chinatown. Just 5 mins or less walk from MRT NE4 and also MRT NE5. Two stops to Harbout Front, Vivo City, bus to Sentosa. Really nothing to complain except for no window in the room. Other rooms had windows, maybe they are more expensive? They showed us the room first and we agreed. NOTE: Singapore offers free wireless to everyone almost everywhere through wireless@sg. It does not reach into the hotel room though, and also not really well in the lobby although it worked in the restaurant/breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Above my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ArchieNY
Reviews.Content: I have to honestly say that my experience in this hotel was above my expectations. We stayed there for 4 nights at a very reasonable price. Although the hotel is not fancy, some of its decor is nice, especially in the lobby. Rooms are OK, only a little small, but above all, clean. Bathrooms are a little old, but they keep them well. Beware of the water in the snack bar, very overpriced. You can go to the nearest 7-11, and buy some water for a quarter of the hotel price. Location is very convenient close to the MRT which takes you everywhere. All and all, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeoulGordon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on a stop-over in early September - rates at that time were cheaper than usual as Singapore was a bit empty before the grand prix. We booked on the Furama website and they twice claimed by email that my credit card was refused - I rang my bank after each attempt and they had seen no transactions from Furama either accepted or refused. Only after ringing the hotel directly and asking them to try again while I was on the phone did they accept payment. I suspect they were using the website rates as a bait-and-switch tactic and did not want to rent me the room at the cheaper rate. Other than the small trouble getting the hotel to take payment, service was reasonable for a mid-range hotel - there were no problems, but no instances of outstanding service either. The swimming pool is hidden away along a long corridor and down some steps - which is just as well really as it is tiny - one look at it and I didn't bother. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Chinatown and the MRT - although taxis are cheap anyway so MRT convenience is not so important. The room had no free bottled water which I thought a bit lacking. We did not try the hotel restaurant so I can't comment on food quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great! So unbelievably close to Clarke Quay!”
Reviews.Author: mscah100
Reviews.Content: After checking out of the other 4-star business hotel, where I had a less than pleasant experience for the past two nights while attending a business training workshop, I moved down the road to Furama City Centre as it was cheaper. The hotel didn't look like a hotel from the outside, which took me aback for a minute when I got out of the cab. However, the first thing that greeted me was the helpful concierge. At the reception, everyone was very friendly and made me feel welcome, despite the busy atmosphere. I got a room on the 8th floor, but it had recently been repainted and the fumes were bothering me, so I asked to be moved. The staff who responded to my request were very friendly and professional, and sorted me out immediately without making me feel like I was being a hassle. I was given a room on the 10th floor right next to the elevators. The elevators didn't bother me, you couldn't really hear them unless you were in the bathroom, and I'm sure there were people using the elevators often as the hotel was fully booked. I'd booked a superior room with a double bed. The room was certainly smaller than the room at the previous hotel, but it was about half the price, and the internet was faster I think, either that or there was no one on it! The bathroom was surprisingly nicer too. One of the best things about the hotel, though, is its AMAZING location. Amazing amazing amazing! I didn't know how close I was to Clarke Quay until I decided to be 'adventurous' and walk back to the hotel after a night out. It was about 5 minutes. If I'd known that I wouldn't have taken the MRT the night before! 3 minute walk to Clarke Quay MRT, 3-4 minute walk to Chinatown MRT. Extremely convenient. Sorry, I can't stop raving about how close it is to Clarke Quay. So overall, pleasantly average rooms good enough to shower and sleep in. Very good staff, which really makes a lot of difference when you're in the hospitality industry. I'd asked to extend my checkout time, but they were running a full house and the lady politely declined my request but kindly apologised to me, so that was fine. The front desk staff were all very friendly, the concierge were friendly too, housekeeping was very nice as well. Great location, need I say that again. Definitely stay here if you're not looking for 5-star luxury, because the location and staff more than make up for the lack of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “hotel needs ove haul”
Reviews.Author: raine50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel five years ago but were disappointed on our return. The hotel is very shabby. Room was disappointing, smelt damp needed to be redecorated, it was apparent that the room had suffered a leak, the ceiling was badly patched up, Pool area bit run down with jaccuzi jets all not working, sun bed cushion were very dirty. Room service was very poor, took two days to get a mug and on two occassion an order for bottled water took two hours to arrive. reception staff and porters were very helpful and friendly. The third bed in the room was not adequate for a third person unless they are a child, something we were not told on booking. Breakfast menu great and good value, in the evenings the offerings were basic and not very appitising.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay…”
Reviews.Author: SGPGuy
Reviews.Content: Booked a Executive Club weekend package thru' its website. Check in was prompt and seamless. GROs/ frontdesk personnel were courteous and approachable. Room was spacious and comes with a panoramic view of Singapore’s CBD/ Marina Bay. F&Bs at the Hotel’s Executive Lounge were adequate; nice dinning ambience; tranquillity. It's all about location, location, location. I would recommend this Hotel for Tourists on a 'mid-range budget' for a business-class hotel. Majority of the attractions/ pre-war historical sites/ Chinatown/ Orchard Road Shopping Belt/ Marina Bay/ Museums are within short walking distance or a underground train/ public bus ride.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Floridaholic
Reviews.Content: In Singapore for F1 Grand Prix and stayed at the Furama CC for 6 nights. Couldnt be better placed as just a walk through the Peoples Park Complex to Chinatown MRT station (4 mins) and about 7 mins to Clarke Quay MRT. Lots of places to eat in Chinatown and Clarke Quay and easy to get to other areas of interest. Only about 10 mins maximum to Outram Park MRT interchange which takes you to several different lines and on to Changi Airport. On arrival at the hotel, our baggage was taken by the concierge. We went up the escalators to reception which took about 5 mins for check in. No sooner had we arrived in our lovely twin bedded room with views of the esplanade and singapore flyer in the distance, than our baggage arrive. The concierge asked if we liked the room and told us about the mini bar, complementary tea and coffee and complementary shower gel, shampoo and skin moisturiser all of which were refilled every day when necessary. Two minutes after he had gone, reception rang to check that our room was ok and we were happy with it. As we were so busy, we didnt eat at the hotel (not necessary as such choice outside) but we had a drink on our last evening there. Drinks were not cheap but this was about 8 pm and it was happy hour so we were told it 2 for 1. When we had finished our first round of drinks (which came with peanuts), the waitress came over with another round and more peanuts. As you can see service was excellent. I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough and we found the cost really good considering it was the Grand Prix weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, big bed, overpriced everything else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: biggaydave
Reviews.Content: GBP55 a night. Nice room with big XL King bed - lean and comfortable. Water GBP5 a bottle, Slow Internet GBP12.50 a day!! Poor food. Dreadfull pool area, broken jacuzi, plastic chairs, gym is no bigger than a cupboard! This place is a decent hotel if you only need a bed... Right by Chinatown and handy for the Gay Bars. The rooms have been given a lick of paint and are clean - though the carpets could do with replacing and the upulstery cleaning. It's a cheap get your head down place... But they do milk you if you buy anything from the mini bar or in the canteen. The buffet lunch cost GBP18 and it was of a very low standard. The seafood had been left out un-chilled and most of the meat dishes were not hot. The mini bar prices are 4 times waht you would pay outside the hotel and the internet was slow and cost GBP12.50 for a 24hr period (That's more than I pay in the UK per month for 2mb. Will say that the rooms are decent enough - akin to say a travelodge or Ibis but the rest of the hotel is lacking greatly.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: GosfordRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Furama City Centre. The room was expensive as the standard room was not available but there were no trimmings. It was comfortable but well used and in need of some renovation. Location however was good and handy to many tourist spots. Preferred the Re hotel not far from this one -very modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: malrose39
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. We stayed here for 2 nights en-route for Brisbane. We had an executive room (although not too expensive) and the room and hotel facilities were excellent. There is a separate 'executive' lounge where new arrivals are seated with complimentary drinks,while their keys/etc are prepared. Each evening between 6pm - 8pm executive room holders are invited to this lounge to have drinks (alcoholic/non alcoholic and as many as you want) along with some snacks (although you could almost make this your evening meal). This is all included in the price of your room. Breakfast for executive room holders is also served in this lovely quiet air conditioned lounge. Omelettes cooked freshly for you and a great selection to choose from. Our room had the most stunning views - it was a great start to a fantastic holiday. Mr & Mrs McNulty Yarm, North Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lilsmit
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Furama City Centre Hotel in Singapore at the end of May on our way to Europe and at the end of June on our way back to New Zealand (home). Both times we stayed there we turned up really early due to our flights, and had to wait for quite a while in reception for our rooms (a little disappointing after very tired after a LONG plane ride). However, we were upgraded both times to very nice rooms, which were spacious, air conditioned and tidy. It was a great hotel to stop over with due to the rooms and the view from the hotel. We would recommend to others going through Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Very good position”
Reviews.Author: SugarZ
Reviews.Content: The stay at Furama city centre was very good : rooms were spacious, clean and nice. Breakfast was very good with a lot of choice of sweet, salty and oriental dishes. Very good is the position : few minute walk to China town pedestrian way and underground and Maxwell hawker food centre (mmmm very good) 5-10 minutes walk to Clarke Quay, very nice for a night walk and for eating a wonderful Chilli Crab at Jumbo seafood ;-)) Next time in Singapore I will stay at Furama city centre again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m_mayhs
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly. They explained to us using maps how to get around and how the local MRT system works. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family. Location is great too. Few mins walk you are in Clark Quay where there lots of restaurants and bars and in the other direction you are in Chinatown. Great service too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best budget stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: browner_
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, and Im now even more convinced that the Furama is the best stay in Singapore for people who dont expect posh and pretentious hotels. We stayed with 2 small children and the massive twin beds were big enough for all of us. There were renovations going on, which didnt affect us at all, but because of this we got a room upgrade, so had a shower as well as a bath. The room, which overlooked the swimming pool, was very very quiet. The staggered room design meant that we were never aware of any neighbours at all. The pool itself was warm and clean and a nice place to relax. The buffet breakfast is standard fare, but was plentiful if relatively expensive. But the best part of this hotel is the location. The proximity to Chinatown means a short walk will offer hundreds of very cheap eating options, if you like oriental style food. In the evening, you can find open air food malls and have a beer in the pedestrianised streets. There is no need to eat or drink in the hotel at all really. The underground railway station is a short walk from the hotel, and this is safe and very cheap. A trip of couple of stations southwards will take you to Sentosa Island trains,ferries and to Vivo City a very large and interesting shopping/restaurant centre on the waterfront. Also , the hotel is a short stroll to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay, and is quite central. This place is highly recommended for family and holiday travellers who may not be rich. A great longhaul stopover. Even the taxi from the airport costs next to nothing by international standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jools0007
Reviews.Content: Best location in Singapore unless you want to stay on Orchard Road and shop till you drop. Straight out the hotel and across the road is Chinatown. Plenty of shopping centres and chinatown knick knack shopping to do. Heaps of places for eating. Walking distance to Clarke Quay and $5-$6 taxi fares to Orchard Rd and Little India. 2 mins from business district. Hotel was having renovations but did not impact on our stay and noise was so minimal. Would highly recommend to anyone for short or longer stays and families

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION IN SINGAPORE'S CHINATOWN”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: The futuristic-looking Furama Hotel was our base in Singapore for four nights. We arrived in Singapore mid-afternoon and were immediately impressed by the spotlessly-clean city as we travelled in by taxi from the airport. Check-in was smooth and our room was large and comfortable. We chose the Furama as we liked the idea of staying in Chinatown rather than the touristy Orchard Road area where the majority of the other hotels featured in the brochure we chose from were situated. The area immediately adjacent to the hotel was particularly busy with a large shopping centre adjoining the hotel. A generous buffet breakfast was included in the price. Our first evening was spent exploring Chinatown, but we were slightly disappointed as there seemed to be more karaoke bars than anything else. We eventually found ourselves in a little bar in the Duxton Hill area of Chinatown by which time all restaurants in the vicinity had stopped serving meals. The friendly bar owner took pity on us and as we left gave us a carefully wrapped parcel of chocolate brownies to eat when we got back to the hotel. The following days we spent taking trips around Singapore Island, visiting Changi Prison, Changi War Cemetery, a fascinating crematorium, crocodile farm, bum boat trips on the Singapore River, Little India, Raffles Hotel, the glittering shopping malls in Orchard Road, and a trip to Sentosa Island in a tropical downpour, mainly using the city’s excellent MRT system. We ate in the Furama’s 24-hour coffee shop late one night, but apart from that took meals on Boat Quay and Clarke Quay, and a wonderful restaurant on board a boat in Singapore Harbour looking back at the glittering skyscrapers of the city. Singapore is a good introduction for newcomers to South-East Asia as it eases you in gently, and The Furama is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great but a tad overpriced”
Reviews.Author: che8811
Reviews.Content: I was directly upgraded to executive room and was given room at high floor since they are having construction done in the third floor 9 AM - 8 PM). The room is basic but very clean, the corridor is also very clean. The only thing we complain is the lack of smiles and politeness by the staffs. But since we never stay at any other hotels in SG, I couldn't justify this.

Reviews.Title: “Very good impression”
Reviews.Author: garmic57
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days at the Furama City Center in July 2008. Was promptly upgraded to an Executive room upon arrival. Staff very friendly and helpfull. If they were keen on tips, they didn’t show it. The gym is not worth its name, 4 basic machines crammed into a very small room. They have a small launderette for hotel guests, handy for a longer stay. Excellent location close to subway and a shopping mall with a cheap internet café in the basement (don’t use the hotel computers, that’s a rip-off). Since I had a late flight back but had to clear my room at noon (a late check-out is charged SGD 140 ++), I asked if I could a shower by the pool before leaving. No problem at all. Overall impression very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Latnad
Reviews.Content: Good location to Chinatown Food Street, and MRT Stations etc. Rooms very small - book a triple if travelling wtih two small children (this way you get a double bed and a single).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleProfessor
Reviews.Content: Reading through these reviews, I think I must be the only one who didn't get upgraded to an executive room on arrival! Instead I got a twin room on the fifth floor. First impressions were not good, as the porters were so keen to get a tip I virtually had to wrestle my luggage off them. Check in was pretty smooth though. Up to the room then, and I thought I had taken a wrong turn - had to pass through some industrial-style metal double doors and down an unpainted corridor with cardboard boxes lining the floor. I thought I had entered a staff only area, but apparently not. The room itself was a decent size, but disappointing in quality. This is supposed to be one of the best hotels in Singapore, but I found the room to be more motel-style than a luxury hotel standard. It was clean, but very basic. No mini-bar, old-style TV with only a few uninspiring channels, no pay-TV, no bath, shower was lukewarm at best. The in-room safe was not working. In-room broadband is available, but rather exorbitantly priced. Luckily with the government of Singapore providing free city-wide WiFi, there's really no need to pay for internet use. Breakfast is expensive, but you get it free if you stay 3 or more nights. Just as well, if I had paid I would have complained, as it was easily the worst I have ever eaten at a high-class hotel. Ended up skipping the other days. On the positive side, it does have a superb location - on the edge of Chinatown, just across the road from an MTR subway station, and just 10 minutes walk to the oh-so-trendy nightlife area of Clarke's Quay, where you can sip overpriced drinks with the rich and beautiful at glamorous riverside venues that rival any in London or New York. So, motel-style luxury, but a great location made up for it. Just. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: emmoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Furama City Centre for 2 nights. Booked Deluxe Room but was upgraded to Executive Club room upon arrival. Very nice, clean and comfortable room, exactly same with the photos shown at their website site. Breakfast was ok but would prefer more varieties. Location is very good as it's very near (less than 3 minutes walk) to MRT station and a lot of restaurants at nearby area. The only thing I dislikes about this hotel is that they don't allow late check-out. My flight was at 9pm and I have requested for a late check-out, about 1-2 hours extra but was rejected. Overall, I am very satisfied with my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: igetfuzzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. We had booked a standard room but on arrival, there wasn't any available so the staff upgraded us to an executive room on the top floor (score!) The room is a bit on the small side but it is Singapore after all. The amenties were all there, flat screen, hot showers, comfortable beds, etc. Can't beat the location either-- it was super close to the subway. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: beckagray
Reviews.Content: The Furama was fantastic. I stayed with my mother on a 3 day stopover on way to London. The room was all brand new looking and immaculate. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. Would definitely go back there and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Overall the Hotel could not convince me”
Reviews.Author: Heiner5
Reviews.Content: Not being my number 1 choice for my stay in Singapore I ended up booking Furama since the other hotels I fancied were all fully booked at the time I made reservation. The location is pretty good if you want to explore Chinatown. Chinatown MRT station is 2 minutes away and you can also walk to Clarke Quay or Boat Quay (loads of restaurants and bars there) in 5-10 minutes. Getting to Orchard Road or Little India you would have to take the very convenient and comfortable MRT though. The check-in was quick and efficient. The room was a little small but OK. Much to my disappointment, the minibar was empty on arrival. When roomservice was in to bring some missing towels I asked about it and they said that is correct so and I should order any drink through roomservice. I tried it out later and they brought drinks within a few minutes, though after ordering a pitcher of ice water they just brought a small glass full. The bathroom was fine, offering a shower cabin and a bathtub, well lit and clean. The room also had a safe and TV set with very limited selection of programs (like 8 or so, only some in english). The breakfast we had was a little downturn. We came in late and they said they close breakfast in 30 minutes. After filling my plate with some egg and bacon, they started to clear the buffet already. When I wanted some fruit it was all gone already (10 minutes after entering the breakfast room). I asked for some fruit and they brought it in from the kitchen but I would have rather selected it myself. There is a Computer in the lobby to access the internet at pretty high rates, dont know about WiFi access. The hotel seems to be the crew Hotel for Cathay flight personnel since there were plenty of them at my checkout which is why it took so long to complete check out. Would I go here again? Well, I guess I rather try out some other Hotel in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: ballerina
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel twice, on our way to australia from london and on our way back. i had booked an executive room and was meant to get 2 king beds. check in was good and our children were given some teddys, and the staff polite. our room was high up and we had a great view of the city. it did not have the 2 king beds as promised, but did have a separate living/kitchen area which was helpful with a baby. there was one king bed, a cot for the baby and a roll out bed for our 4 year old. this worked out okay but we shouldn't have been promised 2 king beds. i was too tired to complain. we ordered room service and were brought totally the wrong order, and then lied to about it. but again we were too tried and hungry to complain! on our way home the stay was somewhat different. i had made exactly the same booking but was given a small room on a low floor with one double bed in and no room for any other bed. it was not an executive room and did not have the beds i'd booked. i went straight to reception and complained and saw a manager who then realised the mistake and rectified it. however the receptionist almost scowled at us because of HIS mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice Great view of the Singapore Wheel”
Reviews.Author: fozzie58
Reviews.Content: Upgraded on arrival, Staff very freindly,lots of smiles. Room was great, very clean and well presented, lots of freebies, bathroom had bath and shower, the shower very powerful spray and they even provided robes and slippers . gym on small side but excellent equipment, Pool was nice but very cold. The great thing about this hotel is the way you can move around the area outside the hotel and all undercover via walkways, so if it's raining, it wont spoil the day. links to shopping malls, restaurants and chinatowns facinating stores. Would i go back - YES indeed.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Furama”
Reviews.Author: SCupertino
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Furama City Centre. The staff was most welcoming for our 1am arrival, and quickly checked us in to our room. The room itself was clean, comfortable, and had all the right amenities. This hotel had an amazing location, right in the heart of Chinatown. We were able to leave our room and hit the streets in just a few minutes. Our friend joined us on this trip and had a room with a view of the esplanade, which was better than our view of Chinatown, so I would request a high-floor esplanade view room. The hotel's skyline makes it easy to find from many points in the city, which is nice. We booked our room on expedia.com, but we found out afterward that the Furama hotel chain has its own website where you can directly book rooms for the same rate and possibly secure free breakfast. Give yourself extra time for checkout - checking out took longer than the average hotel, in my experience. Also, jumping in a cab from hotels in Singapore adds a few dollars surcharge to your fare - if you stay here, just cross the street and hail your own cab if you don't want to pay this surcharge. Definitely would stay here again and recommend the hotel to anyone who needs a place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - noisy lifts”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: Last year, I requested a non-smoking quiet room and was allocated a smoking room next to the noisy lifts! After complaining to the manager, I was moved to the non-smoking floor , with a room at the end of the corridor overlooking the river. This year, my room was on the non-smoking floor, but with a back view and partial view of the swimming pool. But room was good-sized, clean and everything in good condition, but I was only 2 rooms away from the lifts and could still hear the rumbles in the early hours of the morning when all is very quiet. I have complained again about the noise from the lifts. I only ate breakfast in the restaurant once as the food manager was rather abrupt and wanted to close and the buffet food was cleared whilst several of use were still eating. I found this buffet limited and expensive. This hotel is situated very close to Chinatown and 10 min walk to Clarke Quay, so there are plenty of places to eat. The staff, particulary the porters are very pleasant, and I think this is good value and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: k0ke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location close to Clarke Quay restaurants and train. Had a room with a king size bed and a newly renovated bathroom. Lovely views. Were there for just a one night stopover, but would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Good”
Reviews.Author: Gandy75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for a 5 night stay. Upon arrival our bags were taken by the bell boy. We checked in with no problems and given a room on a non smoking floor as requested. We had a corner room which was spacious. The hotel is in walking distance of china town, clarke quay and the underground. The downside to the room was that we had a door connected to the next room. We could hear everything they said and especially the TV noise. We complained to the reception and they said they would let the person know. The next day a family moved in which still continued to make a noice. Again we complained and this time they said they would not put anyone in that room. They also offered us a late checked out 4pm. The bathroom was a little old but was in working order. The facilities of the gym were good and hotel offered restuarants and bars. The room service is not that good as the food came cold. Would recommend this hotel but avoid a corner room with a connecting door to the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Needs to Update Rooms”
Reviews.Author: blessie
Reviews.Content: The Furama is in a very great location - close to Orchard Road, Chinatown, etc. Room we stayed in however, was small, and the toilet area smelt of urine all the time. Had to get the room cleaned everyday. Shower was old and really needs to be replaced. One thing we cannot fault though was the service - all the staff we dealt with were great, courteous and very helpful. Nothing was ever a problem. The hotel package we had included breakfast, but we found it a bit too pricey to have breakfast there - considering what we ate. Did not realize it was a halal coffee shop. Will come back to stay only for its location - that is if we cannot find a better one in Orchard Road - which I doubt very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bel_79
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Furama and I am surprised by a few of the other reviews I just read. The hotel was very well located, close to Chinatown and oodles of options for food and market shopping. We didn't have any problems with reception, if I had to complain about anything the lady at reception was 'overly' chirpy at our 9pm arrival after an 8hr flight. She offered good suggestions on where to eat and what to do at that time of night. The room was excellent, we couldn't believe our luck when we opened the door, we had a gorgeous view over Singapore, a big king size bed, a gorgeous bathroom - it was very very nice and really cheap (we booked a cheap deal directly through the hotel about four weeks in advance.) Yes - there wasn't any milk, which we did find odd - however when you travel through Asia, you quickly learn that the tea and coffee experience is completely different to everywhere else, and no milk is really quite normal. We did ring reception about a hair dryer and they explained to us which draw it was in, in the room. The only other comment I would make is that the prices in the hotel lobby bar a VERY expensive, we were fortunate to get a 'buy 1 get 1 free' deal for beers. When we got the beers they are normally $13.50 each for a 330ml Tiger. However, again this is typical of Asian -it is hard to find cheap beers - which is difficult for us Aussies to work out??? Overall we had a fantastic one night stay, we found the staff pleasant and the location great. Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: TX_Flyer001
Reviews.Content: In the middle of a renovation lots of noise during my stay b/c of that. Front desk staff were very rude to my wife on more than one occasion when she would try and call. They need lower prices or give you more than an old hard bed in a worn out room. ALso need to offer internet for free thats a new concept to them. I would stay some where closer to Clark Quey next time

Reviews.Title: “Dont put up with sub-standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller2007_7
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid 3 months in advance after much researching. It is certainly overpriced for what it is - and that is NOT a luxury hotel. We have stayed at other much better hotels in Singapore. On arrival, after that long flight from London via Dubai and Columbo all we wanted was a 'cuppa'. After brewing we discovered no milk so approached reception for some. After two requests and over 30 minutes later we finally got it - but the tea was cold and so had to start again! Then we discovered mildew all around the bath, the cistern leaked into the toilet and had to refill very 10 minutes with the resulting noise. 'Ended up turning the water off so we could get some sleep. There were a whole host of little 'niggles' including a very worn and patched carpet, stained paintwork, and generally not up to the self promoted "one of the finest Luxury Hotels in Singapore". Certainly a 4 star reception area but after that it's all downhill. However the next morning after nailing the duty manager, Jack Tan, we secured a very much upgraded room on the 15th floor with magnificent views over the city, river and beyond - and an apology! After a day out we arrived to find a bowl of fruit on our dresser with the managers compliments. So if you think you have been 'dudded' - make sure its addressed directly with the management. The hotel is in a good position but badly needs an overhall and a closer watch on details that make a travellers' stay more enjoyable. John & Carole Dickinson

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveller99
Reviews.Content: We were return vistors who will not return again. The hotel has an excellent location but some serious problems. The air conditioning, despite being set to 22 degrees, struggled to keep the room below 26 which is just uncomfortable in the climate. The room service trays banked up for two days. Coffee ordered via room service varied in price - one day is was $8 next day it was $14.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: angwri
Reviews.Content: I arrived at around 7.30 am & was delighted to be told that my room was immediately available. The rooms are well furnished with TV (English channels), hairdryer, iron, roomsafe, comfy chair/footstool. There are lots of nice toiletries included in the bathroom & slippers are provided. My room overlooked the pool which did not seem to become too busy & there is also a gym if you have the time for a workout. The buffet breakfast is plentiful & if you are on a stopover with Singapore Airlines, all meals are half price. There is also good room service & there are long meal times (allowing a lie in or late dinner). There is a bar with evening entertainment. Fairly low key but pleasant with a night cap. The hotel is located on the edge of Chinatown, just a few steps from the subway & the night markets (do try a visit to the Chinatown Heritage Centre). Despite the busy area, it is surprisingly quiet once you are inside.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: kimonbel
