Reviews.Content: The hotel was not as great as I expected for a 4 star. The only plus was the mrt is across the street. Do not eat breakfeast there unless it comes with the room. It's overpriced and not good at all. There is a coffee shop and Swensen's across the street which is priced reasonably. I don't think I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover disappointment”
Reviews.Author: vitanama
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Furama City Centre few times on my trips from Australia to Europe and back. It was ok. On my last trip 3 weeks ago I've booked a stopover with Singapore Airlines with a night in this hotel for the whole family. On our arrival the rooms were not ready. My wife, myself and our 3 kids 15, 8 & 2 y.o. had to spend 2 hours in the hotel lobby waiting for the rooms been cleaned up. Not a pleasant experience at all after the 14 hours flight at 7am in the morning trying to stay awake! As it turned out the hotel was full on the previous night. So I assume that we were actually waiting for someone to check out. In one of the rooms there was a strong smell of cigarettes when we finally got there. The personal wasn't helpful at all. I have the name of the service manager and currently is thinking of lodging an official complaint. What really kills me is that no apologies were given. Overall a really bad experience, won't stay at this hotel anymore and I won't advise this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stopver Choice for a family”
Reviews.Author: JAT_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Furama City Centre on Stopover booked through Singapore Airlines, one of their Group B hotels. We are family of 4, with 2 teenage girls. Chose mainly for location, and from researching other traveller reviews. Easy stroll to Chinatown and Boat Quays, Chinatown MRT nearby, taxis easy to get. After booking, emailed hotel direct to request rooms not near lifts and with good views. Received prompt acknowledgment. On checking in, renewed request, receptionist confirmed had noted email and allocated executive rooms on 19th floor. Both rooms a good size, clean, comfortable, decent bathrooms, great views towards river and colonial/business districts. Pool and gym both nice. Friendly and efficent staff, especially doorman who always greeted us with cheerful smile and procured taxis on demand. Buffet breakfast good value (£5 GBP) with very wide choice of local and continental dishes, eggs freshly cooked to order. Late checkout not available as hotel full, but bags looked after and showers available 3 - 7pm. Downside: agree reception area a bit dark and some decs a bit tired, but not significant concern overall. Would avoid bar - no natural light and musty smell - rather pushy hostess doing hard sell on overpriced drinks - but it did have big TV showing live UK football on first day of new season!! Rather get cheap Tiger beer and noodles at People's Plaza opposite, unpretentious local mall (not touristy) good for jade, Chinese medicine, traditional souvenirs, couple of camera shops (just as good as Lucky Plaza and much less stressful) excellent snack stalls, recommend dumplings & curry puffs. Also had jackhammer noise problem from 10.30am on last day when packing. Staff said renovations in progress. Would have been annoying if earlier or asleep but were about to checkout so not a real problem. Would definitely return for short stopover stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of annoying events”
Reviews.Author: Gavial
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through Singapore Airlines for 5 nights about six months before the stay, mentioning that we needed a non-smoking room (my travel mate has asthma). Singapore Airlines told me this was no problem and confirmed this on the voucher I received. When we arrived at the hotel at 6:00 p.m., non-smoking rooms were not available. First they told us we could wait for an hour to get one. When we agreed to this, they told us we'd better take the smoking room, as there might be no non-smoking room available on that day any more. We insisted for a while and asked if they could call the airline for us. Suddenly, out of nowhere, a non-smoking room became available... On the third day, weird things started to occur: In the morning at 6, we hat an unwanted wake-up call. Someone drunk 3/4 of our unopened bottle of mineral water. 2 towels were missing in the bathroom. On the following days, other such annoying events took place. I guess they wanted to make us pay for our insistance on obtaining what we hat booked. One more thing to mention: on a 5-night stay, they didn't bother to change the bed sheets once. I had stained sheets on the first day, and they remained so tor the next 5 days. Cleanliness is really an issue in this hotel. After a flawless two-week stay in Thailand, this was by far the worst hotel we had (and of course the most expensive one).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if pricey”
Reviews.Author: MrKitty
Reviews.Content: The hotel has undergone a refurb a while ago now. The rooms were decent size, as was the bathroom. The cleaners were very friendly and thorough. The restaurant was pricey, so we didnt eat there. My only negative experience was check out, where I noticed a mistake on our bill - we stayed 9 nights at an agreed rate, but the bill had increased by roughly $300 more after the incidentals were taken off. Please note, even though you pay GST on accom, expect to get local taxes as well. The front desk staff were not friendly, but they were helpful. Decent location to MRT and Chinatown. If you like a walk, Bugis is about 30 mins away and the nearby Clarke Quay offers a heap of dining options. Stay here for the location and the room size, not the customer service. In short, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: A hotel trying to be posh, but never able to. Nice enough rooms. Club lounge not worth the extra money: the drinks are never the real stuff, and the canapés or other offers in the lounge never really up to standard. Breakfast in the club lounge is okay, but better can be had lots of other places: only two choices of fresh fruits (and this is in the tropics!), industry fare teas and so on. Location next to Chinatown is fine, but if you look for shopping, go elsewhere. View is good from top floors – try to get a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Food”
Reviews.Author: Bricari
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8pm and service from the beginning was great. However, some concerns when the toilet in the room would not flush due to no water forthcoming but no other rooms were available for us to move to. This was not our first choice hotel but Singapore is a hard location to book. We had a great room facing east and quiet with a view of the wheel and the cultural centre in the distance. Being close to the Chinatown MRT was a bonus plus we got to eat in chinatown every night - excellent. Whilst not a great hotel its location has advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: HarryKensington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama for four nights in an executive room. It was very clean, comfortable and it had a great view looking towards the big wheel and river. The room had everything we needed including a walk in shower in the very clean bathroom. The hotel was in an excellent location near Chinatown, very easy to get around. The staff were superb, especially the girls in the executive lounge, very friendly and helpful. Yes the lobby is a little dark but lots of hotel lobbies are similar to this. The pool area and gym were lovely. There are two entrances, one on a small side street, not scary as there are plenty of people around. The other accessed from a bridge over the road or from the pavement itself. This leads to a walkway which takes you past a few older shops to the lobby area. Overall we were impressed and would definaltely return to the Furama. We also treated ourselves to two nights at Raffles which we will also review. There are so many things to do in Singapore, it is not just a one night stopover city. We especially enjoyed the Night Safari, the Zoo, go for the Wild breakfast, a bumboat ride, Chinatown Heritage Museum, Changi Museum, the Arab Quarter and the Battle Box at Fort Caning. It was very pleasant walking around, even at night. We felt very safe. Lots of shopping if you want that as well. The only mall we went to was Raffles City Mall and that was excellent. Eating out was superb. We especially enjoyed Blue Ginger, Nonya food, try the chicken and black nuts at Tanjong Pagar. Empire Cafe at Raffles, great local food and very reasonable. Indochine Waterfront, great location, excellent food, fab Vietnamese coffee. Bumbu in the Arab Quarter, great surroundings and lovely Thai/Malay food. The Thai restaurant in Raffles City Mall had fantastic fish. We also had Sunday brunch in the Bar and Billiards room at Raffles which was amazing! If you enjoy spas try the Eucalyptus Spa at Tanjong Pagar. It was really good. It doesn't look anything from the outside but is nice inside. My wife had five hours of treatments for about £125. She had a full body scrub, a Parafango body wrap, full body massage and Shirodhara and Reflexology. She also went to the Amrita Spa at Raffles, more in that review. We thought Singapore was lovely, some say its sterile but we dissagree. We have been to many asian countries and it rates high on our list. We will be going back to both Singapore and the Furama hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms, service can be a varible”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Kiwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a stopover for trip from London to Zealand. I have used 3 times before and was happy with value for money. As we needed rest this trip, I requested a quiet room. I was allocated one next to lift. They changed it to a new room, futher from lift. All was good until they started using a jackhammer on the support for the room 2 stories below. The room visablly shook, and was not habiatable becuase of the loud jackhammer noise. I noticed a letter saying they where doing some maintence in hotel for 3 days 9am to 6pm. Therefore no catching up sleep in that room for first 3 mornings of the stay. I Contacted reception, they said they where full and could not change the room for the whole stay. The work overan, jackhammer started at 8.30, the day after it was supposed to be finished. I contacted the front desk manager, who arranged a late checkout (as we checked out that day) and a room change to a 19th floor room that day. The whole experience put me off the hotel for good. I got no real sleep and was become ill due to being run down on arrival to NZ. It has good food, nice rooms, good location, but customer service at reception sometimes leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean room To sleep in”
Reviews.Author: ConfuseHelpless
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Furama CC. The room is a bit small but clean. The check in service is good but the bell boy not help us out on our luggage until I carried it to the entrance of the hotel. Overall, a good recently renovated. Can still smell a bit of the paint

Reviews.Title: “Furama City Centre”
Reviews.Content: Furama City Center Not quite a 4 star hotel. We were out most of the day so the hotel was adequate for our needs i.e. a place to stay for the night. Below are some points regarding the hotel. 1. Amenities Being that there were two guests in a room, we were given one set of toiletries. We asked for an extra set but it never materialized even after repeated requests. Two bath towels and a bath mat were provided each day nothing else. 2. Staff Handling Situations a. Staff at reception was accomodating. The aircondition in one of our companions' room wasn't working so they had someone fix it. Unfortunately that did not help plus the fact that the rusty sprinkler system fell on my companion's arm!!!! Reception obliged by moving them to another room. Puzzling though was that they sent a plate of 3 fruits and a card for a speedy recovery. Wonder if it was a local cure to rub the fruits to the wound! b. An unfortunate incident happened to one of the guests of the hotel. A Korean woman riding the escalator up to the reception area fell backwards with her luggage in tow. Maybe it was a mistep or something. Anyways, the concierge staff and some hotel staff immediately went to her aid and even called an ambulance. So that was good. The whole point of this story is whilst staff were attending to the woman, staff left the other guests to their own devices. I am not being not being incompassionate but the situation did not require ALL of the staff to attend to the woman- all they did was to ogle at the situation and pinpoint at who was at fault. The hotel should have assigned or dedicated a team of staff to tend to the woman whilst the other staff still carried on with their normal duties. It seems that the hotel forgot they have other guests to attend to. c. Pool Staff There was a pool guy hiding in his airconditioned office. Guests just pick up a towel and return it after use. If I was not a guest of the hotel, I could have easily used the pool without question. The pool was located on the 6th floor across some guest rooms. Usually hotels have a separate wing for the gym and pool. So if you stay in this hotel, don't stay in rooms around 611, 612, 613 etc. just because the hall could be busy with guests going to the pool/gym. d. Concierge There are some concierge staff which were friendly and accomodating like the day concierge staff. The concierge staff during the time of the Korean woman's accident (evening staff) couldn't bother with our questions for directions, and hurridley answered our questions just to make sure we don't bug him anymore. 3. Hotel Environment a. Reception Area - Lighting around the area of the escalator where the Korean woman had an accident was quite dim and not brightly lit. The reception area was also a bit too dark/dim to my liking. It looked dated (apart from the "mod" sitting chairs) and everything looks yellowish with the dim lighting. b. Rooms Adequate and basic c. Restaurant Only had breakfast that came with our package. Again nothing fancy, same thing served everyday. 4. Others Taxi is not that easy to hail but it will come after a while. The MRT is nearby. Interesting shops nearby

Reviews.Title: “It did exactly what was expected, no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: pandpwilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from May 28TH 2007 as part of our big Asian trip. Booked online with their own website as it was cheaper than expedia or asia rooms. Paid around 65 Sing Dollas a night without breakfast. Arrived at hotel around 3am. The staff answered our questions they were not rude but they were not happy smiley either. We had to crash out in the lobby for a few hours (at first they said we would wait until 8 am but we got in at 5 am) no worries there as I had not told them we were coming. However we were not offered a drink, a chance to buy a drink or even a glass of water. They did what they had to do, no more, no less. The lobby and the public areas are tired and in need of a refurb. The plants hanging down the fake marble surrounds were also tired and in need of water, food or replacement. The seats we sat on to wait for the room were stained, missing buttons and there were no cushions. Again the lobby did what was expected at that was it. In the morning, full of people the lobby felt like a different place but even so it was still tired. The rooms were excellent, newly refurbished and for me a very comfortable bed, for some maybe too hard but good for my back. Efficient and fast internet was another $S25 a day and you had to book how many days you wanted with no credit returned so best to do it daily or for each 24 hours you want. The view from our side of hotel (1521) was not much cop but from the parents room (1807) was much better. Breakfast was OK and the usual hotel buffet thing. I never ate, as this kind of medium quality breakfast does not appeal to me, better on the street right outside the hotel (also only $6 a beer!!!). But my wife had an OK continental breakfast each day for around $14 ++. The restaurant staff though for such a transit type hotel in a city like Sing spoke quite poor English and thinking outside the box was not easy it seemed either. We did not eat in hotel otherwise as too many good Restos we know already in Singapore. The hotel was good value for the money (as Sing is so expensive) because the rooms were good, without that I would has been disappointed. Lastly I reported some faults in the room that they did not fix them in 3 days or give me feedback to say they had tried. This for me was the general attitude of the staff as a whole. I would probably try another hotel next time but location is good staff are not rude rooms great and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: aynek
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the location - very easy for walking around the old parts of Singapore and for Clarkes Quay(restaurants). Underground station 2 minute walk. However, the hotel was shabby and dirty. Seriously needs a renovation. Fine for a 1 night stop over, but for no more. We had a number of problems ie phone not working, music being pumped through the intercom in our room in the early hours. The staff were incrediably inefficient and unhelpful and at times just plain rude and careless. Avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ords
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama City Centre after checking out trip adviser a few months back. We left Perth on the Tiger Airlines red eye flight and arrived at the Budget Terminal at 3am. Beware the white prestige Taxi's they are more than twice the price of the normal taxi's. We arrived at the hotel at 4am. We had decided before we left that we would save money and not book in until that day. Book in time was 2pm and we were bloody tired, so we asked the guy on reception what he could do. They let us book in early (6am) and gave us a nice room on the 9th floor.(no extra charge) The next day we realised we were in a standard room but had booked a delux room, so they changed it for us. This room was fine except for warm air con and dodgy fridge. Again they changed our room to a higher floor, this room was better with a good view and everything working. We stayed for 7 nights and had no problems with the service or anything from then on. The only problem seemed to be finding someone who spoke good english on the front desk. I would not hesitate to stay there again if we returned to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: aahk
Reviews.Content: - old - bad smell - dirty - with ant - poor service, not helpful reception - scary The only good thing is good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jakesbackdoor
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about the Furama Hotel. Hotel rooms were clean and efficient. It was a quick 10 min walk to the Quay area. A service station just one block away for snacks, water and cheaper beer. The staff were really friendly and always had a current paper for us when we asked. You can't go wrong staying here

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: traveller89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Furama City Centre on stopovers both ways in route to UK from NZ. We were impressed with the service and cleanliness of the room. The staff were helpful and pleasant. We returned one day from shopping at 3pm to find the room had not been serviced, I approached the front desk and asked for fresh towels and went to China town for food. On return 20 minutes later the room was spotless with fresh towels. Room service was excellent and the food was very good. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and would stay again when in SIngapore.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Chinatown and Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: BlackBeauty77
Reviews.Content: Only 5 minute walk to Chinatown and surrounded by shops and food stalls. Another 5 minute walk in opposite direction to Clarke Quay for night life and great chili crab!! Be sure to distinguish to taxi drivers that this hotel is Furama City Centre and not Furama Riverfront. Most SIA Stop-Overs tour buses will drop-off and pick-up from this hotel which is tucked in, off Eu Song Ten Road. Also, if you don't like the smell of cigarette smoke, demand a non-smoking floor (not just a non-smoking room), as the smell will seep in under your door! Also, if you don't want to be disturbed by house-keeping at 9:15am, put up your Do Not Disturb sign!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: JakartaMember
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Furama City Center hotel. We were there for only one night, but we wish it could have been longer. The hotel location is fantastic- walking distance to Chinatown and the Boat Quay/Clarke Quay area. It’s close to the Chinatown metro stop, which is only a few stops from Orchard Road. The hotel itself looks brand new. The room was not huge, but very bright, clean and modern looking. The service was excellent. At check-in we mentioned that our flight was not until 9pm the following day, and they offered us late checkout at no charge, without us even asking. I used the business center and made a few print outs, and when I went to the front desk to have them charged to my account they said, “Oh, don’t worry about it.” Not big things, but it really made us feel welcome. The breakfast was great. It was included in our rate, and would have been worth extra. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. I have stayed on Orchard Road a couple times (Le Meridien and Meritus Oriental), and the Furama City Center is a much better deal. We booked through Asiarooms.com

Reviews.Title: “We loved Singapore !”
Reviews.Author: YEBO
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite acceptable and good value for money . We stayed for 4 nights en route to Perth from South Africa. We ate in the hotel dining room 2 nights runnning and the food was delicious. Attentive staff . We loved being in the middle of China Town and found the public transport convenient , cheap adn reliable. Room was fine and we had no complaints at all. We ate breakfast in the local markets , lovely mangoes, grapes and bananas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jewelshamanaptra
Reviews.Content: We booked this as part of a package with our flights as a Stop Over and having read earlier reports on here I expected the worst! I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, we did have to wait for our room to become available as we arrived at 7.30am and the room wasn't ready until 11.30 but they stored our luggage, we went walk about and it wasn't a problem. Most hotels won't allow check in before 2pm so why some people rage about being kept waiting I can't imagine! Loosing your cool over it won't help either............they will keep you waiting longer! Its just a block away from China Town and 10 mins walk to Clarke/Boat Quay with a shopping Mall on the way. Its a very pleasant hotel and more than adequate for a Stop Over and would stay there again. The room was quite spacious too and just down from access to the Gym and outdoor pool. Both of which looked lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chez5678
Reviews.Content: The Furama is a typical business / tourist hotel. Perfectly fine, clean and in good location but nothing special or different about it. Wouldn't choose to stay there again although nothing wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug5646
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on Eu Tong Sen Street next to Chinatown MRT stop for two nights - nothing spectacular. Executive room on 21st floor with full buffet breakfast for two was S$225 per night plus 17% (service and taxes). Executive benefit also includes some lesser amenities, including cocktails in 23rd floor executive lounge between 6-8 PM. Buffet breakfast was extensive but typical and nothing special. Hallways outside rooms (at least on 21st floor) smelled of mold or mildew, possibly due to the constant high humidity in Singapore? I wonder if the Raffles also has the same smell. Executive room was small but adequate for two travelers. As usual, anything from the minibar is outrageously priced. A can of Tiger beer was S$9.00. For those who do not drink alcohol, water was available for same price.

Reviews.Title: “Near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: ceprincipal
Reviews.Content: Positive: Near Chinatown, helpful staff, excellent complementary breakfast, near 2 subway stops, near shopping, wide variety and price range of restaurants (including McDonalds for those that want a $.30 icecream cone after a hot day of touring and shopping) Neutral: If you want to be near Orchard Rd., stay somewhere else. Room was average in size. Large hotel. Negative: It you take a hot shower, the fire detector will go off. The rooms are clean; however, the carpet had stains.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HolidayBiz
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Asia and stayed at the Furama twice. Once for 8 nights and the second for four. On both occasions we enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the lovely low key swimming pool, and the incredible convenience of being so close to Chinatown and the metro stop. There were also several convenient buses running just outside the hotel. We love to look around the city rather than lounge around the hotel and we found our room perfectly adequate in size and comfort, clean , and freshly made up each day. Maybe people who like lots of frills would prefer something more up market but honestly who needs a flash bar at the swimming pool???? I simply couldn't believe the review I read from a felllow NZer who called it a horrible horrible hotel. For us it was simply excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: camsoo
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in november for 3 nights.Right in the heart of chinatown plenty of shops and places to eat.Hotel was superb very friendly and helpful staff.Room on tenth floor was very spacious and clean.Had a nice outdoor pool which was always quiet and a nice bar though drinks were quite pricy but would definitely stop here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_acct
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week long business trip to Singapore during which time I stayed at the Furama Hotel, City Centre. Overall I had a positive stay there. My room, whilst just a standard one was more than adequate during my stay. It was kept very clean by housekeeping and was serviced early in the day meaning fresh bedding and towels by early afternoon. As advised on here I requested a room away from the elevators, wise advice indeed. I discovered when I was using a room on my last day to have a shower (The hotel provides this service free if you have a late flight leaving Singapore after you have checked out) that was next to the lifts that they are pretty noisy and can be heard clearly through the wall. Another tip I picked up here and would also recommend is to buy your water downstairs at the store round the front of the hotel run by the older guy who also sells electronic goods. He has a fridge in his staore and charges SGD $1 for bottles water compared with the hotel price of SGD $4 from the mini bar The beds, whilst pretty firm, were OK and comfortable enough to get a decent nights sleep. The aircon appeared to have been preset and was not adjustable (at least not in my room) it was set at 23 degres celsius, but the room itself was not stuffy as a result. The bathroom was fine, the shower was great with a good high pressure head. The towels were a bit on the thin side, but they did the job. The staff at reception were great, they were very helpful and knowledgable. They seemed to manage to solve any issues that arrived during the week I was there very well. They also made an effort to remember me and follow up on previous enquiries I had. I only ate breakfast there, but I found that fine. Standard hotel faire but perfectly edible. Prompt and friendly service from the restaurant staff meant my coffee cup was rarely empty. Whilst the address of the hotel is Eu Tong Sen Street, the entrance is on Havelock square which is off the main road. Taxi drivers are not mad keen to go down there as it means they can get stuck at a set of lights onto Havelock road getting back out. As a results a few drivers dropped me off not at the entrance but on the main road, not a hassle as it is only a 100m walk round the building to the entrance. By the way tell taxi drivers it is the Furama Chinatown as it is easier for them to get the right hotel. The location of the hotel is good as it is only a 10 minute walk to Clark Quay and Boat Quay, the centres of the bar and restaurant scene in Singapore. Chinatown is good also for Hawker stalls (cheap and good food) and a bit of shopping, though for the latter head to Orchard Road. If asked would I stay there again, I would say yes.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable if you want to be in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Furama CC is near the major attractions of Chinatown but it is not in the middle of things as other reviewers mentioned. Our room was really nice with huge windows. The room was recently renovated and included a fridge. Our bathroom had a nice sized shower and a separate tub. The water pressure was amazing! We received coupons for a welcome drink which was a nice touch. The MRT is really close and cabs are easy to find in the area of the hotel. Cons: The concierge was useless!!!! They could not handle even basic questions like "where can I find live music in Singapore". Breakfast was decent, just nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rfpst1
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Furama two or three times a year since 1997 and have never had a bad experience. From my perspective, it is the perfect hotel in which to recover from the jet lag after the long flight from LA. There is a great outdoor swimming pool and a small but perfectly usable gymnasium. Last time I was at the Furama, in December of 2005, my room was not ready when I arrived, so they put me in what I assume was the Presidential Suite for the night...full kitchen and two bathrooms etc. The staff has always been accommodating and helpful. The restaurants are great as well. On the rare occasion that I stay with friends while in Singapore, I always make it a point to stop at the Furama's coffee shop for a cheese sandwich and tomato soup...a little bit of home in Singapore. Did I mention that it is a three minute walk to Chinatown and the MRT? Overall, a great hotel, great location, and great price.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ariane123
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Furama City Centre, the first being in 2003. I'm pleased to say that it was still very good value and lived up to expectations, although the Happy Hour is now nowhere near as good as it used to be! This time we chose a room on the Executive Floor and I'd say that we had a bit more space than in the Deluxe room. We also had access to the Executive Lounge at all hours, and it was nice to be able to make coffee/tea and eat home made biscuits and also to partake of the hors d'oeuvres between 6 and 8. As always, we thought that the room was kept very clean and the bathrobes were big and comfy. I love the walk-in showers and choice of toiletries as well. The MRT is just around the corner, and taxis are really cheap for us Brits (used to London prices!) so we used both to get around Singapore. The staff were friendly and even made a birthday cake for my mother (free of charge) when they realised it was a special occasion. Just to note that the electrical shop next door sells big, and cold, bottles of water very cheaply so you can stock up there (tell him "the British lady who hates football" sent you!). We would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the pick of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 20 minutes by taxi from the airport however the MRT station is 50m away. It is only a short walk to the Singapore River area, however, after our previous stay at Swissotel Merchant Court this hotel is definately a lower standard rating. The hotel requires renovations. The pool area was unloved so we welcomed the news that work would be done as it was a shame for the great location this hotel has. We took advantage of the Executive Floor package. However, it was not what we expected. Our stay at the hotel had us only meet another couple using the lounge at the same time. The view was great from the E.F. lounge but that would be the only bonus. The breakfast had a small buffet available. Our room was okay, the bathroom was not the best and really felt as if it was a standard room. Might be more suited to the business or single traveller.

HotelInfo.Name: Furama City Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 60 Eu Tong Sen Street, Singapore 059804, Singapore
